content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
"Yet another simple but good game ..." This game makes fun! You kite around a lantern and must survive several waves. On 4th wave you'll have enough money to buy a better weapon (I prefer the sniper rifle) or start to build up your camp. Therefore are wooden or steel palisades and turrets where you can mount all weapons.Every wave you evolve more. But the zombies do also. Each property of their damage, life and speed raises by a factor. There are even more effective weapons like a rocketlauncher, the tesla coil or a lasercannon, but the ammo is mostly too expensive or the reload time is quite too long. Another mode is the endless night mode. which you gain after 10 waves of survival. In endless night mode there are no palisades. Weapons spawn by random of killed zombies. Here you must survive 5 min max. The MP is stable and makes fun. Achievements are partly deactivated for MP. Don't miss this little but nice game. The devs have promised some more content if you support them.

content:
Posted: October 30, 2014
												This game is a great arcade-esque style shoot em' up and I adore it. I played for a few hours with a friend and it was a lot of fun but I have a few suggestions to improve gameplay:1. SKILLS-You can put a point after every round into a skill-Skills could be like: accuracy, damage, run speed. and scavenger (get more from cash/supply drops)2. GUN UPGRADES-Pay to get various upgrades/attatchments to your guns-Such as: incendiary (does dmg over time) explosive (hurts more than one target) or like an increase in damage, accuracy or firing speed3.CHARACTERS-We need just a little bit of character development, who is "The Girl"? Or "The SWAT"?-I suggest adding MORE characters and giving them each starting attributes depending on who they are like: The SWAT gets a defense bonus due to his bulletproof vest.4.TRAPS-You should add more traps and trap like elements to the game-Such as a bear trap that costs, say, $50 and you could put them in a 1/4 space of a normal tile-Fire traps would be cool5.PALISADES-Palisades should decay with damage and you should have to pay to repair them-The advantage of this would be you could add in palisade damage. As in they do damage to zombies based on how new and freshly repaired they are.These are just a few suggestions that I thought could make this game better, even though it already is pretty addicting.-ZacP.S. Add some detail to the map, just a few cracks in the concrete or litter. Something to make it more immersive.EDIT: Nearly a year later, I played this game again and saw that the devs practically took all my ideas and implemented them and I couldn't be happier! Skills and traps have been added and so have harmful palisades! They also added a couple of aesthetic details to the map! Awesome work guys and thanks for using my ideas :D

content:
Posted: March 28, 2014
												I could likely sum up this entire review by simply stating the title of the game in question: Yet Another Zombie Defense. Intended as a sideways joke at the ridiculous number of zombie themed games flooding the market, it extends beyond the name to every aspect of the game, resulting in a bland and unimaginative isometric shooter that even for the low price is hardly worth a second glance.If you've ever played a wave based survival shooter you already know exactly how YAZD functions. Enemies come at you in increasingly difficult swarms, which you then counter by buying guns and defense in between rounds. Rinse, repeat, and try to stay alive as long as you can. It's a formula that's been done dozens of times over, but when executed properly can be immensely addictive and rewarding.You can probably see where I'm going with this, so I'll just spell it out: YAZD doesn't get it right. A surface summarization of the many games that inspired it, it has the right pieces to potentially make a great game but doesn't know how to use them effectively. Progression is severely limited and uninteresting, with only a handful of unimpressive guns to choose from and even fewer defenses, as well as no upgrade system or other means to provide something to keep playing for beyond a highscore. Enemies are repetitive to far too great a degree, making for a dull experience after the first few waves as you begin to go through the motions, and the banal presentation leaves a great deal to be desired.To be perfectly fair, YAZD isn't broken on any fundamental level, it's just not fun. Everything it attempts has already been done infinitely better in so many other games, that I can't bring myself to recommend it for even a quick look. There's an argument to be made for it being cheap so expectations are obviously lowered, but personally I would recommend spending a bit more and getting something more polished and deserving of your time. You might be able to squeeze an hour of enjoyment out of it with a friend if you really try, but that doesn't make up Yet Another Zombie Defense being as hollow and lifeless as the undead it pits against you.You can read more of my writing on Kritiqal[kritiqal.com].

content:
Posted: November 9, 2015
												Short ReviewEver heard of Orion: Prelude? Terrible launch game with infinite amount of bug and generally unpleasant gameplay that got relaunched not once but 3 times but eventually end up somewhat good enough to play and cheap enough to justify the few remaining bugs? Well Yet Another Zombie Defense is a bit like that except it never got relaunched, there was hardly any bugs, the graphics are♥♥♥♥♥♥♥and contents are barebone. Yet I am actually recommending it because:A) It does what it say it does well which is a horde based game defending against zombie.B) It was already super cheap to begin with. And C) It actually got updated.At its core Yet Another Zombie defense is a topdown shooter that has you defending a highly important streetlight for as long possible and to accomplish this you kill zombies to get money for turrets, barricades, ammo and more guns with random drops happening throughout the match. It used to be that the game has practically zero content but now it has more turret and barricade types and far more stable netcode.BTW Netcode as in COOP. Thats right one of the major saving grace apart from all the alphabets which I have listed is that it has coop. Defend against the undead hordes with up to 3 other mate with a total of 4 people in 1 game and with the price chances are most people already own it. Money are shared between all 4 and only the host can decide what to buy so bickering will happen.Its a pretty fun game, not much of a substance, does what it does well with minimalist gameplay and graphics. What more could you ask for about a game defending a streetlight probably covered in meat from the undead horde? For the cost of a couple of high value cards you and your mate could probably enjoy this stupid thing for a few hours and thats more than enough in my book.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2014
												People write reviews for this game like it's the new AAA title that is diabolical with beautiful graphics, game mechanics, and all that jazz, which delineates a terrible game if one were to quickly glance at the reviews. However, people fail to realize that this is supposed to be a fun little zombie shooter, heck, that's why it's priced at $2.That being said, some of the game mechanics are a little wonky, but that just makes the game more enjoyable right? Also to mention, please check out the screenshots before hand, I don't see why people complain if they don't fully check out the product. Would you purchase a new computer without checking out the specifications? I certainly would not. So why be too myopic to glance at the entirety of the game. I personally thought this game was quite enjoyable for $2 and I even 100% it in terms of achievements in 2.5 hours (you can do it faster if you don't screw around, but it was nice to goof off). It's a nice zombie defense game to play with friends when you want to goof off and just enjoy yourself.Lastly, you will certainly enjoy this game if you have ever played the game "Box Head" as it brings back the intense moments of running for your life and wondering why you didn't purchase more ammo. Combine that with some achievements and you've got a steal deal for $2.Overall, this game was quite nice for a $2 zombie shooter, please don't expect it to be the next AAA title. Yet Another Zombie Defense brings back the feelings of "Box Head" and even throws in some achievements and inane game play for you and your friends.

Basic InformationTitle:  Yet Another Zombie DefenseDeveloper:  Awesome Games StudioPublisher:  Awesome Games StudioGenre:  Top-Down ShooterGeneral ImpressionYet Another Zombie Defense is very well designed top-down shooter with some tower defense elements. content:
Posted: August 8, 2014
Yet Another Zombie Defense is a small, unpretentious game that manages to do what it wants to do quite well. The objective is very clear: defend yourself against ever increasing hordes of attacting zombies (hey - that's in the title!). So I went into it, as in quite some of these small and cheap games, I do admit, for the trading cards, and since I love games with Steam achievements. During the first encounters things got on in a rather predictable way. I managed to survive several waves of attack circling around a single lamp-post with nothing but darkness surrounding me. There was the ability to buy new weapons and ammo in between the rounds, but no upgrade possibilities for the weapons, to name but one thing.Also, I could place some fences, but that produced a rather weird result, since the fences can't be turned around so stand as soldiers in a row awaiting the onslaught. And slaughtered I got, out there on my own in the darkness.This morning, I decided to give the multiplayer co-op a go, and made my game open to anyone who wanted to drop in or out. And that made quite a difference: people came and went, staying for some seconds or longer, and suddenly it proved to be quite some fun to blast away at those pesky zombies. I do have to admit I find it difficult to watch other players jumping around like grasshoppers on speed - be a man, stand your ground and shoot!!All in all, a small diversion for the dead moments in between the more serious games, but hey, this game didn't pretend pretend to be anything more than just that.UPDATE - August 2015After coming back to this game after a year, I have to say the developers polished it nicely since then, adding some more interesting weapons and most importanly: zombies can drop extra powers for the player, such as invisibility or invulnerability. These help a lot and make the game more enjoyable. I was pretty impressed that multiplayer still seems alive, and I enjoyed hunting for some more achievements.Recommended: unpretentious but well-made game with some challenging achievements

Posted: April 20, 2015
												So much stuff done right for such a cheap game!1. The Good.- lots of weapons to use, from pistols to chainsaws and tesla guns;- plenty of buildings from palisades to turrets and mines to place in order to help you survive - and make zombies go boom!- RPG elements (can pick traits to improve like reload speed, extra health, health regen, etc.)- resource management - money and ammunition are all important- 2 game modes - a strategic one, and a brutal one where surviving over 3 minutes is a success of its own- multiplayer with still plenty of active people online- The music - albeit the game has only 2 relatively short music tracks, I love them both. The Main Menu music has that ERA/Enigma vibe, and the combat (level) music is heavy metal kind of the XBlades 1 type.2. The Bad.- repetitive- only 1 map- only 2 music tracksThe Conclusion:An amazingly good game for 49 cents in my opinion, perfect to fool around with to relax and break the everyday tedium, or as a nice filler between your crazy good AAA games. Even if you're a huge cheapskate and think that 49 cents is still money, deduct 24-30 cents from the steam trading cards that you will sell and you get a perfectly fine SP/MP experience for just 19 cents. That's cheaper than a chewing gum, for God's sake. Get this game, have some fun, and maybe come play online with the others as well!

content:
Posted: March 28, 2014
												Not bad for $2.00.  If you are someone who lies really cheap games, I wouldn't hesitate if this game went on sale (Its cheap enough as it is anyways).  The gameplay is very simple-it consistes of you (single player) or other players (multiplayer) being surrounded on all sides by zombies.  Like the many games that came before it, each level brings ore zombies as well as more powerful zombies.  After each round, you can place turrets, barracades, or purchase guns.Pros:Music-It was the first thing I noticed when entering the game.  It kind of reminds me of the music from Kingdom Hearts when you are going through the tutorial.Turrets- What I though was cool about the turret system was that you buy a seperate gun for each indiviudal turret, and you have to buy ammo for them.  In similiar games, the turret already came with a gun.  I like this aspect because it lets you decide what to do with each turret.  (In the multiplayer game I was in, we put pistols on them because they are the cheapest weapon and the ammo is free.)Multiplayer-This is by far the best part of the game.  My first multiplayer game was with some of the top players (Given this is the release day).  They were very friendly and we made it quite far before the host had to leave thus ending the game.Neutral:Gunplay-I like the look of the guns and the musslefire.  But, the major downfall is that the shotgun packs little to no punch and the flamethrower is god aweful.  The other guns are fine.  Overall, I wasn't too satisfied with the gunplay.Cons:Graphics-It didn't really bother me that much, I'm not a very picky person when it comes top graphics.  I consider them to be par.Level(s)-There is only one level.  It is very simple with one lightpost in the center.  You can see so in the screenshots.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Conclusion:The game was enjoyable and the price point is completely reasonable.  Its not a groundbreaking game, the title speaks for itself on that one.  Its simple, yet fun to play for a little while.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2014
												Yet ANOTHER zombie defense is a decent entry in the zombie/survival genre despite the over-saturation of zombie games in recent years. STORY & GAMEPLAYChoosing one of three characters, you must survive for as long as possible by constructing and buying resources by day and defending by night either alone, or with friends and strangers up to four players. The game presents you with an assortment of weapons and accessories to aid you in your zombie slaughter. Ideally in zombie shooters the most expensive weapon is the most effective. That concept is no different on Yet Another Zombie Defense: Expensive = Effective. You can either buy weapons during day break at full price, or wait for a discounted sale to hit in later days. You will burn through money fast; therefore sales provide you with an option to cash in on low-price gear. You can effectively create your own “safe zone” through the use of auto-turrets and two variants of palisade walls: Wood and steel - the latter being more durable to zombie attacks. You can have all sorts of combinations, though their effectiveness will be tested in combat.The online portion works just as well as the single player with a drop in/drop out feature. I had some lag drops here and there, even during my own hosted lobbies though not too often that would ruin the overall experience. Players can communicate via the in-game chat box and host is able to kick players who are otherwise trolling or lack contribution. From the several games I played the community is rather active, friendly and helpful which is a major plus.The current offering is satisfying, though for a limited time. The game lacks weapon/fortification upgrades and variation in terms of maps. Once you breach wave 20 you will stop and question whether it is possible to progress any further as zombies become ridiculously over-powered in terms of speed, durability and damage. Future updates are promised by the developer (most recent being 14 August 2014) possibly free of charge, therefore it would be nice to introduce additional features to build on the current game.I only played this game with an Xbox controller, therefore cannot comment on the functionality of keyboard and mouse. Xbox controls handled well without any problems.GRAPHICS / ART STYLEAesthetically nothing impressive. The character and zombie models are almost identical to those in Garry’s Mod. Delivers an entertaining game of mindless zombie killing.AUDIOBetween 4-5 different tracks; nothing major in terms of variety. Some sound effects were off-sync – i.e weapon shots and zombie growls.OVERALLA fun but limited zombie shooter with a not-so-ridiculous price tag. In dire need of additional content to bolster its current offerings.PROS+Two modes which can be played alone or co-op + supported by leaderboards.+Nice assortment of weapons and tools to change gameplay.+Ridiculously cheap.+Developer is opposed to the idea of charging players for additional content (DLC).CONS-In dire need of additional content – especially map variations.-Unexplainable lag in single player and online.-Some sound effects off-sync.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2016
This game is ridicolously fun!Let's explain in what it consists:The Defensemode is more a tower defense game than a shooter. If you are good enough to trick the system with your base you will go all the way trough the first 20 nights or so. Then it becomes more challenging. The Endless Night mode instead is definitely a zombie shooter and you need to be very skilled to go over several hordes.Last mode is Deathmatch in which you'll have to play against an opponent while you and him are facing zombies hordes.Major improvements I would adviceIn Endless Mode you should "save up" weapons and ammos so if you find a weapon you don't have to lose the previous one you were using. In Defense mode the building system should be improved: it's pretty hard and tricky to remove barricades.In Deathmatch the drop rate for the losing player should be increased otherwise if a player starts to win he will be advantaged.Open the game to modders! This will create a new fan base who will eventually build maps, weapons, characters, skins, textures, new zombie types and new modes as well!Minor improvements I would adviceI'm looking forward to some graphic adjustments, other bug fixes (e.g. you get spawned out of your base so you need to be clever when you build or you'll be spawned out of your walls!), new game modes, and a bit of a storymode with funny dialogues and interactions (e.g. Blood and Bacon).Final Score: 8/10You can get it for 50 cents and play with your freinds for several hours. I use to spend more money on playing billiard and it doesn't last so long and it isn' as fun as this! It can still be improved and they are still working on this as far as I can see.Find a couple of friends and throw some cents at this game! You won't regret it!

content:
Posted: May 13, 2016
												Yet Another Zombie Defense is as the title suggests, a zombie defense. I can't really say much about this game, but I guess I'll start at the price. This game is quite affordable at the price of £1.59, although I got this in a sale for £0.39, and I'd say that it's most likely worth it. The game's design isn't unique or out of the norm, but it doesn't go to say that it's a bad game, at all. The zombies work well and don't bug from my experiences so far, nor do the items for sale (guns, barricades, turrets, etc). However, there was an issue that happened to me a few times, and really annoyed me. After 'daytime', when the night starts and swarms of zombies attack, occasionally your character would not be able to move or equip any weapons other than the starter weapon, the pistol. Only being able to use the starter gun and look around isn't good, especially if you've progressed really far by yourself; just a side note, the map isn't really that large. I'd love to see a new map added that was much larger and had run down buildings in which you could put turrets in.The Co-Op is good. There's Multiplayer, Singleplayer and Local Co-Op, the Steam Trading Cards, Leaderboards and Full Controller support add to why I believe this game is good. There are 3 Characters, the 'SWAT', 'Boy' and 'Girl', which aren't too imaginative and do not have any personalities. There aren't many online lobbies, but playing with friends or hosting a lobby is still pretty fun. To add to that, there are 3 game modes, all of which I like.I'd recommend this for people looking for a quick game to pick up and play; like I previously said, there's not a whole lot to say about this game, it's not bad, but it doesn't stand out well. I enjoyed playing this game myself and would recommend this game to those considering buying it.

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 17, 2015
												Saw this was £0.39 on Steam (75% off) and thought YOLO how bad could it be!This game is actually pretty good for a small simple game that it is. The goal is to survive hordes of zombies trying to kill you and you have some variety of weapons and defenses to help you. There are two game modes, Defense and Endless Night.DefenseFirst of all you can choose to play solo or allow others to join you when choosing this game mode or you can choose to find a game hosted by another player. Playing with others does help survivability however only the host can buy items such as walls, weapons, turrets and ammo.You start with only a pistol to defend yourself and earn $ by killing zombies. You can buy weapons, walls and even turrets which can have any weapon mounted on them as you see fit. You do need to make sure that you buy ammo for all of the guns that are in use however because turrets will be useless if they are not shooting because of ammo shortages. In the later levels repairing walls and resupplying ammo can start to get very expensive since the zombies also progressively get faster, tougher and stronger.The area you have to build is a little smaller than the edge of the map where the zombies will be spawning and you have a single lamppost in the center of the map providing some light. The very edge of the map is an invisible barrier and zombies will just spawn instantly so can occasionally block you if you happen to be running the edge of the map.Lastly the items that you can buy to help your survivability sometimes can be bought slightly cheaper because they go 'on sale' which can be helpful but sometimes it can take a while for them to do so, in which case it might be more viable to buy them at their full prices.Endless Night ModeIn this mode you can also choose to play solo or allow others to join you when choosing this game mode or you can choose to find a game hosted by another player. Again playing with others can help survivability but in this mode you cannot build defenses, you can only run around so make sure not to run into each other with a horde of zombies either side of you and get trapped! This game mode runs 'endlessly' until you die, there is no daytime in which you can buy weapons or defenses or ammo, there is just one single night that lasts until you die. You can however pick up weapons dropped by zombies upon their death but the ammo is very limited for these so you will run out and your pistol (which has infinite ammo) will be pulled out again.OverallGreat game for only £0.39 that i bought it for, does have achievements that took me only 5 hours to achieve but its a very simple fun game and for that price you can not go wrong! For reviewing completeness the game does also have Steam Badges if you are interested in those too!

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 1, 2014
												"Yet Another Zombie Defense" is a co-op game where you and your friends have to kill zombies on a small map, that is the only point ... but that is pretty fun ! Up to 4 players can fight together, using a man, a girl or a member of the SWAT (the only difference is the skin, nothing else).There are two modes.The first one is the defense mode. You have to survive waves of zombies over and over until the end of your lives. Each time you kill a zombie, you get some dollars plus from time to time money, medic kit (enables your team to recevor health) or ammo (you need to have at least one weapon to get ammo, that does not take into account the pistol that you have at the beginning because you have infinite ammo for this specific weapon). After each wave, you recover your health but the zombies get stronger : they will deal more damage to you if they bite you, they will be faster and you will need more and more hits to kill them.In order to survive, you are able and you have to use your money between each wave. You can buy different weapons (rifles, shotgun, flame thrower, tesla, rocket launcher, laser, ...), but always remember to have enough ammo tu use them ! Tip : I think the best way to go is to buy only one weapon so that, when a zombie drops ammo, you only get the adequate type of ammo. If you have two or more weapons, you are going to drop at random two types of ammo, and if you are looking for one specific kind, you might be unlucky and get the other one.You can also buy barricades (wooden and steel) and auto-turrets and place them on the map, almost wherever you want within a medium circle from the center of the map. You can build up to 5 turrets, and for each of them, you have to buy and mount a weapon on it to get it active. Them, each time the turret shoots a zombie, it will use your ammo, so be carfeul with your stock ! The idea is to protect your turrets with barricades because zombies can destroy them, and since they are pretty expensive, you have to keep them alive.Remember that only the host of the game can buy stuff and place items. You can ask for specific weapons, but the host has the final decision. I think that you should spend the first four or five waves killing the zombies with your pistol (which is free thanks to inifinite ammo), then you are likely to buy the weapon you like the most. There are also "sales !" : at random, between each wave, some items are going to be cheaper (-25% I guess), so you might want to wait if you are looking for a specific item and maybe get lucky after the next wave, unless you die ...In the end, you have to get the highest score you can to get your name on the leaderboard. The second mode is the endless night. As indicated, there is only one wave of zombie, but there is no end to it ! No money on this map, no barricade or even turret to build, you have to kill zombies with weapons. There is a lot of zombies and they can drop weapons : as soon as you pick one of them, you have to use it, you cannot get your previous weapon back (unless you drop it again). The aim is to survive as long as possible, so try to gather medic kits when you need one of them, and never stop running !To conclude, this game is pretty fun, maybe it is lacking a little bit of content, but with two modes, Steam trading cards and 18 achievements to unlock (5 hours should be enough to get them all), it is worth its price, which is quite low currently :)

number of helpful: 8 of 11 people (73%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 29, 2014
												Despite the name, Yet Another Zombie Defense is more a dual stick shooter than Tower Defense game. There might be a few elements, reminiscent of Tower Defense strategy, but success owes much to the player’s ability to react quickly via the use of their hands.Working on a wave basis, each in game night pits the player against an increasingly large, tougher and faster horde of zombies.The weapon selection is decent, but the fortification side of the game – the purported tower defense – is an absolute snore. Perhaps my expectations for Yet Another Zombie Defense were off-base. I was looking forward to a sharp mix of light tower defense strategy and arcade action, but what I got was a competent but unremarkable dual-stick shooter with sentry turrets and blocks- reasonably fun, but quickly forgettable. Overall 6/10.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 14, 2016
												Yet Another Zombie Defense developed by Awesome Games Studio Sp. z o. o. & released on 28 March 2014 on the PC Platform. It has an average score of 6.9 on Metacritic (http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/yet-another-zombie-defense) & surprisingly, this is also available on the iPhone/ipad. There are tons of zombie defense game out there but this title came at a ridiculous low price. As a fan of Tower Defense game, I couldn't pass this up and not wanting to be conned by the mass steam reviews, I dig up game play footages and reviews and finally made the purchase. I am all for  value for game play experience and this title deliver it in that aspect.For the sake of this writing, I am going to use short form. YAZD is all about surviving endless waves of zombies. You can either play it solo or co-op; 4 person multiplayer. It's that simple and to aid you in your survivability you'll be able to purchase weapons, barricades and sentries. The game currently offers 3 game modes:  Defense - your normal defense game; you need to survive each night@level against x number of zombies. During the day, you get to build your defenses/resupply and during the night, you fight off the hordes of zombie. Endless - you are thrown into the game with hordes of zombies. There is no day - you kill zombies and hope that RNG will drop weapons/supplies for you to pick up and survive. Good luck. Deathmatch - for those who want to pvp.Controls:The controls are simple. Standard keyboard; WASD & mouse.Visuals:I am not sure how to word this. On overall, the feel is Plain. Simple. No details, no textures. Bare minimum visuals.  You are loaded into the game with 1 lamp post right in the middle of the map, which gives you light source. The rest of the map are dark. So environment wise, its barren.  There's only 1 type of zombie throughout the entire fight. They switch from walking to running. There are some different cloths zombies but that's it. The human characters are designed okay. There's the boy, the girl and the SWAT. Each designed nicely and colored just ok. No broken/weird animation. Weapons, no textures but each has been designed properly with their respective effect; shotgun, kick back and pellets. Tesla gun, a large coil thingy  which zaps stuffs. Laser weapons that slices stuffs into 2. In that respect, they are okay. My personal thoughts:Upon launching the game, I saw the simplicity on-screen menu filled with zombies. I went: URK! and my eyes went o_O" I was taken by surprise lol. I am not sure how the mass would react to the screen but i'd suggest another loading screen not to scare off certain audience.I didn't understand what and how the UI work. at all! That was until 2 hours later..where I emerge from the tons of dead zombies and do a victory pose *punch the air* I understood how the darn UI, barricades & the sentries work.My game play experience from that moment onwards, was simply fun. Fun because I know what the heck I was doing and at the same time I was trying to accomplish certain achievement(s). If you see me running around with a pistol beyond night 6, it's not that I am _tupid but because I am lucky & skillful enough to be able to execute it unlike certain people out there. This is my strategy to rake up money to build my ultimate defense for the team. When I went to play with others on multiplayer, it's the same awful co-op experience just like every other game out there suffers. Lack of team work, different ideas, in-fighting...all this is going on as the horde of zombies is breaking our defenses. Urg! If I could just point my chain saw to their face and @#$@#! and re-focus back onto the zombies. There were also people who kept crying for weapons when the team were low on cash/fixing up the barricades. What is wrong with these people..The game play is darn simple. Some may find it uninteresting. The weapons, defense mechanics are also darn simple and thankfully they work! but some may still find it uninteresting. So what do these people do to make the game interesting? The cheat the crap out of all this simplicity. Tsk, Tsk, Tsk! 999 million on night 1? Come on.......how hard is this game..... T.TYAZD in it's current state leaves a lot of potential and improvement to be made. While I am aware that the devs have promised to make  some improvements, here's what I would like to see if possible.  An improved UI and a section for help; in-game explanation on barricades and weapons.  Introduce new form of barricades. Introduce new form of weapons/mines/traps. Introduce environment and if possible, make some interactive option; water, bridge, trees, fire,electric, Any form of skin/clothing customization would be welcomed. The devs can even earn some side income from here. more achivements? =p Support for controllers on the PC version in the future maybe?While many would suggest for new enemies, I dont think it's fair or possible to do so - between solo and co-op play (for the achievements purpose). Right now, its free for all. You can do it solo or co-op to get those achievements. I really hope it stays like this because more and more games out there are forcing people to band together to complete certain achievements. It has it's benefits but most of the time, with all the awful online gaming experience out there, I would rather solo it. When a game does it the right way, it becomes meaningful else it just feels like another chore of "oh, crap. I need a team for this x achivement. help! Someone? Anyone!"My SummaryThe way I see it, with a little bit more touchup/improvement YAZD can be really fun. It is already fun and with such a cheap price tag, this is a bargain for a simple fun game. But in the long run, the devs need to work on the game to retain its player base.If the devs overhauled the mechanics to allow players to scavenge/make traps/build weapons - expand on the day light game mode; allow players to travel, engage and do other stuffs. This could retain your player base and give some sort of sense of progression. . By then YAZD could turn out to be another gem product in steam. Unfortunately, till that day arrives, I'll be running around the single light post with broken barricades everywhere and lots..lotttsssss of dead zombies. So on the scale of 0 - 10, my personal rating for Yet Another Zombie Defense is a 5/10. *starts the chainsaw* >:-D

content:
Posted: January 13, 2016
 A funny co op game! The title of the game pretty much says what it is about. It is indeed a zombie tower defense in which you have to survive as long as you can, you can get money and with that money you can buy guns or stuff you will need for survive the hardest nights. Also, you can get upgrades that will make stronger, faster, etc.The game itself is not bad, if offers a good time with your friends and it also have different games modes. Also it offers archievements and trading cardsI have a few problems with this game though, it can get a little repetitive, since the game is too simple there is no a high replay value, once you unlock every archievement is pretty much over.Another thing is, I personally don't enjoy playing solo as much when I was playing co op. I feel like the fun in the game comes from the co op experience. Don't get me wrong, I know there are plenty of people who enjoy the solo experience in this game, is just not for me.So, for the final question "Do you recommend this game?" Yes, yes I do, the game offers a funny co op experience and you can try to unlock every archievement, but I think you should have a friend to play with.My score 7/10.

content:
Posted: April 5, 2014
												It's way too simple. That's the fault. The actual gameplay is solid enough, and actually feels cleaner than some other isometric arcade shooters I've played (more expensive ones to boot). The survival aspect isn't bad, since you actually do have to utilize barricades and whatnot if you want to survive at later levels, because zombies increasingly become faster, stronger, and more durable. At first you can just kite the circular play area and the few zombies who decide to run faster towards you can be taken care of easily, while you outrun the rest and pick them off later. Further on, though, when the zombies all have high speed levels, you can't outrun them for long, and you have to either kill the quick moving ones immediately, or use barricades to hold them off and survive. For the asking price (dirt cheap, or free in a past free Indie Royale Bundle), it's actually a really clean feeling game. It's just lacking in depth and variation. The developer is always asking for feedback on the game, suggestions, etc, and says he'll add more upgrades, game modes, etc if there's enough interest. Everyone was bashing this dev, but to be honest, he's doing things the correct way. He didn't bite off more than he could chew, he made a simple, playable game with good fundamentals and nice clean graphics, and will add to it from there. Much better than so many other indie devs who bite off way more than they can chew and put out a glitchy, unplayable piece of crap, or ones who make up for their lack of skill by making things too weird and 2deep4u, or getting lazy with "retro" graphics.All in all, it's not going to blow your socks off, but if you can go find me a game for $2 MSRP that blow my socks off, well... I'll eat those socks.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2016
 OVERVIEW Yet Another Zombie Defense is a defense building action game developed and published by Awesome Games Studio. The whole concept is that you are a human that is being overrun by zombies night after night, Every night you survive you will have money to allow for you to upgrade weapons, get palisades and buy turrets. The goal is to survive as long as possible with or without the help of friends. PROS + Easy Achievements+ Steam Trading Cards+ Co-op+ Multiplayer+ Fun+ Cheap+ Easy to Run CONS - Not The Best Graphics- No Save Feature CONCLUSION This game is a big bang for you buck. It has a fun and easy concept that allows for you to get sucked in very easily and can become very strategic over time. I do have to admit it is a hell of a lot more fun when you have other people to play with. Although it might not be much to look at, and not too much to come back to, the fun I had in this game with a few friends really allowed for it to be a hidden gem. 7.5/10

content:
Posted: January 4
												Yet Another Zombie Defense is a zombie survival game so as many other it have no story.It's all about defending yourself against the infinite number of zombies attacking every night. In the end all of your prayers are to find a quiet place to fall into a peaceful slumber.The graphics are great. The textures are very detailed. the animation of movements, firing, blood, the zombies and your character are quite impressive.The gameplay and controls are good WASD for movements, R for reload, G to throw grenades Lclick to fire and using the mouse to aim. It support gamepad.  You get to choose the character you wish to play with either the guy, the girl or SWAT.There is a huge variety of guns. From small machine guns to heavy full assault rifles.You can create your own game or join other's. You can play with up to four other players. The more the better, right?The multiplayer mode works smoothly without any problems. It's pretty fun to play with your friends.The soundtrack is just perfect hyped fast tempo at night and sad at day. I really liked it.The settings and options are great. You can adjust the volume of the Music and Sound FX, adjust the brightness, change the resolution and change the key bindings.You get three card drops of five card badge. You have eighteen achievements why not giving it a try.If you are interested in reading and discussing reviews. Check Cassus.org

												I'm giving this a game a thumbs up for it's simplicity and the price point of $1.99.  Let me begin by saying you do get what you pay for.  The game starts out just the same as it ends.  In what looks like a parking lot with a single lamp post, you begin to construct a very few simple structres.  By building fences and auto turrets to keep the zombies at bay as you try to stay alive as long as possible.  There is no variety of zombies and no changing of levels.  But as I said the game is only a few bucks, and if you play an hour here and even just a hour later you get your moneys worth.   I experienced no crashes, no glitches so it seems stable enough as it is simple.   While I played only a short while there is the co-op option which makes survival a bit easier, so all in all, a simple zombie defence game for a few bucks.  Money well spent.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2015
												Yet Another Zombie Defense is a simple yet fun zombie survival game. In this game, you can build turrets and barriers to protect yourself from incoming zombie hordes and/or just use your weapons to overcome them.There has been quite a lot of changes since this game has been released, such as level-ups that allows you to increase your speed, reload speed, health and health regen, electric barriers, stronger turrets...Don't forget that you have to mount the turret with any guns of your choice after you build it, otherwise, it's useless. There's about 10-15 different weapons and they are quite different and interesting to use. There's also 3 gameplay modes, there's online multiplayer and local multipayer. You can also play this game entirely with a controller!Sadly, the game has many flaws. After a few hours, it becomes very repetitive. There's a few bugs too... The zombies animations are quite sluggish and their hitbox is a little weird. There's about 2 soundtracks in the game and they're not very good and they get very repetitive. Also, in online multiplayer, if the host goes innactive, you have to wait until he comes back or leave the game. The host can also kick anyone, decide not to start next wave or not buy you any weapons that you want, so don't expect too much when you play with strangers.Overall, the game is very cheap and it's one of the reason it's getting a positive review. It is not a bad game, but it gets boring too quick. If you play this game with a few friends, it is alot better. So, buy a 4-pack and play with your friends if you want some survival action!

												Within the time I've played this game, it helps pass the time. It's like a basic tycoon game in which you can earn money as you kill zombies. As you progress, the zombies become stronger and more lethal. Trying to survive 10 nights might seem difficult enough, but getting at any point past night 10 is difficult if you have less than four people. Trying to get all the achievements can be a challenge and makes more goals to go after in this game. What I liked most about this game is the accessibility to auto-turrents and the ability to mount any weapon on top of them, making them fierce allies if you're able to protect them. My personal favorite weapon is the Telsa Ray, which can attack up to three zombies at once, and is basically an instant-kill gun. I love the idea of ammo sharing and whenever some gains a health pack you get some of it too. It was definitely worth the $0.69 I paid for. Even though I currently only have 2.6 hours on it, I expect to add more, seeing a this is an enjoyable game to play.Some things to know before you play:You can have up to 4 people playing with you.You can customize your server to personnal or to publicThe game becomes harder as you playIt matters where you place everythingThe Rocket Launcher is not a good gunThe auto turrents are VERY usefulAt random nights, there are sales on various item in the storeNever play aloneThe street light is your friendSome thing that could be added:Better assortment of weaponsNew barricadesPossibly new mapsNew charactersNew game mode (Example: A defending mode where you have to protect the street lamp from the zombies.)Few various tweaks on the AIs of the zombiesVoice chat in the gameAnd maybe a few bosses that come out each night during the horde, to add a little spice to the game!I hope this helped you and gave you a proper decision on whether to buy this game or not, but I will say this; It is defininetly worth the amount of money it is being sold for, very fun and low graphics, meaning you can have a fast gameplay on slow laptops, like mine! Enjoy the game!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
												Yet Another Zombie Defense is a fairly simple top down twin stick shooter with some tower defense elements thrown in. Basically, you are thown in with nothing but a pistol and fight off a wave of zombies. These are the nights. Then, once they're all dead, it goes into a section where you can use the cash you earned from killing zombies to purchase and build. These are the days. You can buy guns, ammo, turrets to place guns on that will shoot automatically, and walls that can be placed to help stop the incoming waves. During the night stages you can pick up drops from the zombies like ammo crates, money stacks, and full health. Health will come back between rounds, but if run out of it during the night, it's game over. The walls and guns become very necessary for later rounds as the zombies continue to increase not only in numbers, but in speed and health as well. You're going to die. It's just about how long you can survive. Eventually ammo will run out, walls will get destroyed, and you'll be overwhelmed. And that's basically the whole game. Simple, but with possibilities and strategies to try. Oh, and there's an endless mode with is similar except that... there's no day stages. There's also mutliplayer, which is where this game really shines for me. You can play with up to three other people (meaning four players total including yourself). That means four times the firepower, and a game is only over if every member dies so... better odds. Just make sure not to get in each other's way and do your best to cooperate. Playing online is a great way to make this game more enjoyable and interesting, as you can see other people's skills and strategies. I've played much more online multiplayer with this game than single player, and it's one of the few games I actually play online anymore.I also want to mention how cool some of the other things are in this game. It has some neat music, which is nice. The way you can build walls and turrets to create a defensive outpost between rounds is a lot like a tower defense game, and it's a cool way to implement that genre into this top down twin stick shooter type of game. It's basically what I think a new arcade game would be like. I like it.But every game has some downsides. The online can be awfully laggy at times. That can be due to distance, but... it's still a major drag since there's no local co op for this game, another downside. Also, while graphically it looks alright, artistically it is a bit drab. It's a zombie apocalypse, I get it, but that doesn't mean I have to like the dark, dirty look. Just a personal preference thing I suppose. Also, there's this weird system that allows everyone to use the money to buy things in private games with friends, but in random online matches there's no way to do so. Only the host can buy things. It works out alright, but the fact that it's inconsistent is strange to me, and not really explained anywhere either. The heads up would help. Speaking of that, it'd also be nice to get a little warning on the turrets. See, you buy the turrets from the shop and then you can place them. Pretty easy to figure out. What's confusing is that you're supposed to mount a gun on them. This could've been conveyed a little better. Many times newcomers will buy a turret and place it then be confused as to why it won't shoot. Well you have to have another gun to mount on it. And that gun also uses ammo. You start with many extra pistols to mount to them, which is nice enough, but being given a small heads up on a few of these features might have been nice little things to add. Also, there are supposedly more updates coming... but they're taking long than expected as well as longer than announced. So don't base your purchase on new features coming as it's still a bit up in the air. However, let it be noted that, at the very least, more stages to pick from would be very appreciated.It's still a pretty fun little game. Nice for a time killer. Simple. Easy to learn. And for two bucks, it's worth it. Wait for a sale even. I got it cheaper and even I think it's worth the full price. Yet Another Zombie Defense gets a 6/10 for being a fun, simple, arcadey experience in a more modern time.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2016
												A good price for a game that can provide a good amount of fun.As I never tried Deathmatch Mode, I won't be able to provide much information about it. You can go against 3 other people while zombies increasingly grow in number and speed. Weapons are randomly scattered once in a while on the battlefield, even among undeads.Endless Mode follows the same concept for what concerns Weapons (Randomly spawned on the field) Along with  Power-Ups. Zombies will get faster and aggro will keep increasing. Ammunitions are never dropped, so you're forced to cycle through Weapons.Defense Mode is what you'll probably play mostly: Survive at night and gather Money and Power-Ups (Health; Faster Run Speed; Faster Reload; Invisibility; Invulnerability; Grenades; Mines; Ammo) Dropped by Zombies. Daytime marks the moments where you can buy Weapons, stock up Ammunitions, Mines and Grenades and place bought Turrets and Barricades (Which comes in different variations). Turrets can mount different Weapons (Keep in mind that the Ammunition for that Weapon will depletes as faster as the number of zombies grow) And can be destroyed as easily as barricades. And while, by every night, Zombies will gain faster speed, higher damage resistance you too, every 3 nights, will gain 1 point to invest in Faster Reload Speed, Health Regen., More Health, Pickup Range and Faster Movement Speed.Getting the Achievements is not difficult and while the game is nothing special nor noteworthy, it will offer fun without stress or broken expectations. It does its job properly: Having fun while relaxing, killing without feeling guilty. They were dead already when I started.

content:
Posted: August 20, 2014
												I've read a fair few negative reviews for this game, but after playing it for a few hours, I don't think they're justifed. This is an indie game, priced at £1 something - it's good value. Some people might moan about the graphics, the lack of scenery or story line - but  1) doesn't need  story line (It's zombies wanting to eat you - what more do you need?) 2) The singular lamp has a certain atmospheric effect that gives way to the impeding darkness. 3) It's an indie game - don't expect amazing graphics. (Not that it needs it) This game isn't about amazing graphics, it's about survivability... and fun.If you play this game with friends, it's an almost guarenteed laugh fest as you (probably) squelch beneath the horde of zombies. I've played this as a solo player and with friends. It's more enjoyable with friends. The only annoying aspect of this game is that you can't keep your money or weaponary between games.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
Surprisingly fun wave-based shooter. It's simple, yet still entertainingYou start with a pistol, and shoot zombies wave after wave. Not so original, but the game is very aware of that, hence the name. You can play the game Solo, or Online up to 4-players Co-op.No problems with multiplayer, works fine!After each wave, you can place defenses, such as barricades and turrets.With some planning you can get quite far, but it does require you to try few times.Achievements are pretty easy to get, I got all 100% in few hours. Some you might get without thinking about it, but others may need few tries to get. There are steam guides for achievements, so that helps.Overall, it's fun zombie shooter which brings nothing new to the genre, but is still entertaining for few hours in small sessions. Price is low, and you can pick it up on sale for even cheaper. Definitely worth the asking price.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 19, 2014
												So, let's define what a typical video game zombie horde is:1) Dumb as a rock2) Highly predictable3) Extremely numerous4) Individually fragileFrankly, this game's biggest failure is that, instead of just making the zomibes more numerous, which would make sense, they make them individually stronger AND more numerous. Hey, kids, want to play a game where each of the 60 on-screen zombies take a whole assault rifle clip to kill? Where the basic weapons are vastly more effective than the advanced ones? Well, you're in luck, because this game exists.In a nutshell: If you're looking for something to tie into a drinking game at your next LAN party, you might get a few kicks from this. Otherwise, you're looking at 20-30 minutes of entertainment for your 2$. It could be fun with weaker zombies, and with more weapons and features, but if you just -really- need your zombie survival fix, go play Unturned instead.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2014
												Yet Another Zombie Defense is a fairly accurate title for this game, mimicking the style and setup best seen in Nation Red (a highly recommended zombie shooter) with the added flair of defense buildup in the form of palisades and auto turrets. Although a bit genuine, the defense buildup only serves to slow down the hordes and keep you pinned in a single spot trying to snipe off incoming hordes, which I found unintuitive, as it was much easier to circle strafe around the entire level while picking off the trailing hordes.The music is awefully repetitive, but can be turned off, while the weapons lacked sonic and visual punch. Aside from scoring achievements, this game might not hold your interest for too long, unless the developers add more content as they promised. 2.5/5

												This game is awesome. Basically your typical zombie defense game where you survive as many waves as you can while purchasing items as you progress. I really enjoyed how easy it was to pick up, and how challenging the game gets as you go past wave 10. I would love to see more variation to the zombies, or perhaps boss-like rounds, would also love to see more content as this game could probably go stale within a week or two. If you're looking to 100% this game, it's totally doable. The sniper achievement is a little tricky, but if you try enough you'll eventually get it (took me about an hour to get that single achievement).

content:
Posted: March 31, 2015
												I had received this game as a gift from a friend who bought it while this was on sale, and after playing a bit, I went out and bought a few extra copies for my friends. I spent maybe 2 dollars total for my friends and I to all play together.TL;DRIf you're looking for a time killer, this is definitely for you.I recommend this game, even more so when on sale.Pros+Great for blowing off steam+Decent Graphics+Game actually presents a challenge & requires you to think+RNG for item salesThe item sales are entirely random, and requires you to check on them every level to make sure you can get a good deal+Dirt Cheap and well worth the $2 you pay for itI wouldn't mind spending extra cash on this to grab copies for my friends, and this is an even bigger steal when on sale.+Cheap enough to where it's convent to buy a copy for a friend+A few wacky weaponsLike the freeze gun and laser.Cons-Later levels are almost impossible soloI'd highly recommend buying a copy for a friend and teaming up, as the zombies get really strong later on.-Only two gamemodesDefense and Endless, would like to see a "Play as zombies" mode or even a campaign-No storylineMinor thing, this game is great without it-Limited character optionsYou get the Swat, Girl, and Boy. Given this has a maximum of 4 players, 4 skins would be nice.RatingThis is an easy 8/10.Great concept, great gameplay, and a great game to sit down with friends and work on getting the top rank on the leaderboard.

												After selling the Steam Cards, this game came out to about 64 cents; and given that I've already put in over an hour to the game (with at least as much time left), and it's only in Alpha - I'd say it's well worth purchasing.It's very simple:  buy weapons and baricades to kill increasingly plentiful, powerful, and speedy horde of zombies until you're eventually overrun. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												In just the short time I played the game, I do have a few pros and cons to point out.Pros: It's a fun top-down zombie shooter, especially when you can co-op with other players. Endless fun until you're dead, aim to be at the top of the leaderboards.Cons: Unfortunately, there seems to be some major lag when playing with other people online. =( I think the only way this game can be enjoyable and lag-free is via LAN with some real life friends. Some other notes also, I bought the Auto Turret, thinking it's a machine gun turret that'll fire at zombies if they get too close (dunno if it can rotate 360 degrees or not, or if zombies have to be in front of it, or if it can shoot over barricades). But when I bought it, I watched as the zombies went up to it, bashing it, and destroyed it, and it never fired a single shot. =( Is there something we're supposed to do to get it working? Or is it just a broken item? Another problem also is I found the Flame Thrower to be utterly useless. Short spurt of flame, then reload. Short spurt, reload. Never seen a flame thrower with such a small capacity, and when I played one online game with this person, it was just an utterly useless weapon. The shotgun turned out to be the better option as the spread shots would hit multiple zombies better than the flame thrower (also flame thrower doesn't seem to catch zombies on fire, or you just don't see the fire animation on the zombies, so you can never tell if you got them or not).So yea, unfortunately the cons outweigh the pros right now, as I can't think of many pros. It is fun though, and I love how it has trading cards too (selling those should cover the cost of buying my copy of the game). I hope the devs work out some bugs, and polish it up abit. After all, it's supposedly a "Zombie Defense" game, where you gotta survive, but at the same time you can build barricades and turrets, you'd think it could be a tower defense game as well. Sadly, what good is a tower defense if the tower (in this case the auto turret) doesn't even work? It's utterly pointless to even have in the game then. =-(I'd still recommend this game to friends, but only in the hopes that this game gets some free updates or even free extra content, then it'd be all worth it.*EDIT* Ha, ironic, I didn't realize it, but there was this small window still open in the backround after I had exited the game. I looked at it, and it was a thank you from the devs for playing the game. It also said if the game became popular and would earn ratings, they will include extra content free of charge, with new weapons and even game modes. That just made my day, thank you devs! =) Though I won't be editing my review on the cons till all noted issues are resolved. XD But I will recommend the game!

content:
Posted: February 14, 2015
												Wow!  To call this game a 3rd-person view of Killing Floor would be a disservice to both games, but the similarities are still there.  Do you like killing zombies?  Do you like building defenses?  Do you like to think through your tactics more than simply blasting through them?  If so, then this game is definitely for you.  Grab a friend or two, make sure to get on voice chat so you can plan your tactics and coordinate the building of the fortress.I bought this game on a whim, and I'm having far more fun with it than games I've spent $10-20 (or more!) on in the past year, so hey, if you have a couple bucks, give this one a try! and if you have an extra dollar, buy a copy for a friend.  You'll both be glad you did.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 20, 2014
												YAZD is a very limited an simplistic game in the same mould of Nation Red.  Basically you play one character in an 3rd person arena shooter where you must take on and defeat wave after wave of harder enemies.  The longer you survive the higher your score. Though unlike the excellent NR, YAZD has only one map, no perks, one type of enemy and very limited replayability.  Infact once you've made the achievements there is almost nothing to bring you back.  Except maybe getting the best score on the leaderboard.There are three character types to choose from but none of them have any diffrenciating abilities.  Between each way you can buy new weapons to shoot down the waves of enemies.  In addition to your starting pistol these include: SMG, shotgun, flamethrower, assault rifle, sniper rifle, rocket launcher, laser and tesla coil.  These weapons can be mounted on automated turrets to increase the number of weapons firing during a wave but, at a cost.  Defensive obstacles can be brought to construct a temporary base to increase of survival.Perhaps its one true plus is the coop for up to four players but even then the session leader is the only one who purchase the weapons for the team.  Where its different from say Nation Red is that ammo must also be purchased for each weapon.  If this runs out during a wave you only have your basic pistol to rely on.  Which means almost certain death after wave 5.Gameplay is very repetitive but can be fun in short bursts.  Though eventually you'll succumb to its limited capabilities and uninstall.  Be warned - Only recommended on a 75%+ discount, 90% if you can find it.

												I got this cause at one point it was one of the cheapest games I had ever seen on Steam, and admittedly I didnt expect a whole lot out of such a low price but honestly I was rather pleasantly surprised.The game is rather simple, just shoot zombies with different weapons and try to survive with different means of defense that you can buy inbetween increasingly hard rounds.For me the enjoyment comes from the fact that it is simple and easy to pick up and play. The game doesnt expect you to learn some bizarre new mechanics or anything, you can just pick up and get playing.Now the only issues I have is that the visuals of the game at times can get very dark and I have been attacked by Zombies without realizing because of it, also the game tends to lag later on when there are lots of bodies on screen, though given the small price I'm not terribly bothered by that.Overall I'm glad I got this game, its nice and cheap and you get your money's worth.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 31, 2015
												I had received this game as a gift from a friend who bought it while this was on sale, and after playing a bit, I went out and bought a few extra copies for my friends. I spent maybe 2 dollars total for my friends and I to all play together.TL;DRIf you're looking for a time killer, this is definitely for you.I recommend this game, even more so when on sale.Pros+Great for blowing off steam+Decent Graphics+Game actually presents a challenge & requires you to think+RNG for item salesThe item sales are entirely random, and requires you to check on them every level to make sure you can get a good deal+Dirt Cheap and well worth the $2 you pay for itI wouldn't mind spending extra cash on this to grab copies for my friends, and this is an even bigger steal when on sale.+Cheap enough to where it's convent to buy a copy for a friend+A few wacky weaponsLike the freeze gun and laser.Cons-Later levels are almost impossible soloI'd highly recommend buying a copy for a friend and teaming up, as the zombies get really strong later on.-Only two gamemodesDefense and Endless, would like to see a "Play as zombies" mode or even a campaign-No storylineMinor thing, this game is great without it-Limited character optionsYou get the Swat, Girl, and Boy. Given this has a maximum of 4 players, 4 skins would be nice.RatingThis is an easy 8/10.Great concept, great gameplay, and a great game to sit down with friends and work on getting the top rank on the leaderboard.

Posted: January 5, 2016
												Yet Another Zombie Defense is an indie game by Awesome Games Studios. From my playthrough of it I experienced a good time playing with my friends, which I bought a copy for them.THIS REVIEW GETS A LITTLE LENGTHY. MY RATING IS 8/10.____________________________This game has a lot of potential, the graphics are simple, but sometimes a little too simple. I really hope that more to the map will be done, and more maps will be created. The flat ground doesn't feel like much, and having a map to explore or move around it would be fun, and add to the experience. The map itself is also a bit too small, and when zombies crowd on you, there isn't much room to run.However, I like the shop and money mechanic. I think sharing money adds to the teamwork and cooperation, but sometimes someone random or your friend can just waste the money on something dumb, and non-progressive to the game. I like this mechanic, but it can be annoying.I really hope more characters will be added, as my friend usually play as the same person, making it hard to see who's who until I press Enter to chat. I think it would be nice to have a button the allows gamertags to be visible over players during gameplay, and not just DURING the chat. I love the multiplayer, it runs so smooth! I can easily connect to my friends by just inviting them, and it works so well. The developers did a really nice job with that.There is a nice variety of weapons, and some are pretty OP, and useful. They work well when you need to take on a horde of zombies. However, the ammo can run short fast, and paying for it is costly. Some weapons aren't even useful (or work well) and they are expensive, however I found myself enjoying some of the cheaper weapons to my favor. The upgrade mechanic is nice, allowing you to upgrade almost after every level.In conclusion, I like this game. It's fun, and a good time waster. Hopefully more gets added soon, because I will definetly come back to play. The complaints I have with the game are minor, and I can overlook them. I give this game around an 8 out of 10. It's really enjoyable gameplay wise to just shoot stuff and upgrade, that I can overlook the cons.

content:
Posted: January 7, 2016
												Well, I grabbed a 2-pack for 74c. I've played 3 hours now and have unlocked 89% (16 or 18) achievements. The game is surprisingly fun and a good challenge, until you die then everything is gone and you start again. The games don't tend to last very long, about 10-15min on average until you figure out a good strategy.Playing online with others is ok, however it is a little complicated to learn the buying system for others. Also only the host can buy, the host needs to keep ontop of keeping ammo stocked, only the host can build and mount guns to turrets and lay mines.If you treat it like a simple challenge, the game is great. There's nothing amazing about the game, but hey its 74c for 2 copies! what can you expect!Also! At first my game was launching using my onboard graphics rather than my Geforce video card which created some mouse lag. Go to steam library, properties of the game, find the button to view game files, rightclick on the executable and make sure it is set to launch with graphics card by default.Cheers!

content:
Posted: November 1, 2014
												This game is very small so there is not so much to talk about, so this will be a short review. This mini-game is a fun indie where you fight zombies (duh), there are 3 options for your character who you can play as, the guy, who is an average guy, the girl, who is an average girl, and the S.W.A.T, who is a... Swat. There are a range of defences like barakades (useless sticks), Steel Barakades (same thing just has grey paint) and an auto turret ( a broken gun just lying there), the barakades are just a smalll wall of stacked up sticks which somehow attracts zombies, the other barakades are just stronger, and the auto turret, tell me if you get it to work, (P.s. I recomend you dont get the defences). apart from that there are a range of weapons, from pisol to laser, shot gun to tesla gun, they are all awesome. the map is a simple flat land from a birds eye view with a lamp post in the middle of it emiting light, as you get closer to the edge it goes darker. zombies with differant clothing aproach you in round 1, as you defeat them, you get money, and a chance to drop a bonus pickup (like in cod) which could give you 'Bonus Money' or 'Extra Ammo'. At the end of the round you go into a shop menu, where you can buy weapons, ammo and defences (dont buy defences), every now and then there is a sale at the shop and you can get things way cheaper. if you are playing the multiplayer option and you buy 2 of the same guns by accident, dont worry, that means 2 of you can hold a weapon at the same time! (press tab for differant weapon). overall i really like this game and hope you decide to get it, oh and try not to die.13/15 stars

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 23, 2015
												This was the best 75 cents of my entire life. For those who want a full review, read on. Otherwise, I give the game a 9/10 for a low price and fun gameplay.I found this game randomly, saw it was 75 cents for a two pack (ON SALE), and instantly got it thinking it would be only decent, but it's actually really good! This is a very simple game, and as such it is not very difficult to learn the different mechanics. As the title may suggest, this game is about defending yourself from zombies, but it's in a third person perspective and it's done pretty well overall. This game offers two gamemodes, which are Defense and Endless Night (which can be unlocked by getting to night 7 of Defense). The 3 characters are Guy, Girl, and Swat, and they do not (as far as I've seen) have any difference between them. I think it would be cool to add some special characteristics to make the characters different; such as the Guy having more Defense, the Girl having more Speed, and the Swat having more Damage or Firing Speed. Every Night in Defense mode you can buy upgrades like fences or weapons, and so you evolve from night to night. But as expected, the zombies slowly get more challenging too. This game is a masterpiece for the asking price of as little as 50 cents for a copy, and is still fun. For those who have that little amount of money in their steam wallet, I highly recommend getting this game. It's lots of fun.Yet Another Zombie Defense - 9/10

												This game, this game... When I was a young lad, about 3 or 4, my father gave me a gift on my birthday. I opened it up and there was nothing there. Then, I went on Steam, and wanted to play a masterpeice. I had two dollars in my account and I saw a game with such a beutiful title, "Yet Another Zombie Defense." I still guffaw in awe to this title, it works so well. I played this constantly. I got my entire family into it. We built bunkers that barely worked, used so many great weapons. Then one day, I played a round that I got all the upgrades and all weapons. I was the coolest cat in class. Even my teacher, Mrs. Fowl asked me how I did such an amazing feat. After that, I became depressed because the game was so easy it took me 7 minutes to get all upgrades and weapons. I was finished. The game I played so desperately was gone. I used everything. I left this game forever and I vow to never play it again. The end.Yaas Gaga.This is not a true story.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 9, 2014
												I'm not a big fan of filler; That's why I couldn't finish skyrim, so I'll just cut to the chase.The Good◦ It starts out pretty strong and has some great features for a new game.◦ It has a simple and intuitive interface. Gaining an understanding of most, if not all of the game mechanics takes less than 5 minutes.◦ The first few games are intense and fun.◦ Multiplayer is a nice feature and works(relatively) smoothly. The community seems nice enough.◦ Decent sound track, albeit royalty free.◦ A unique "sale" feature where different items are discounted every day.The Bad◦ The game is simple, but so much so that enjoyablitily and replayability are nonexistant. None of the features themselves are bad... it's the lack thereof.◦ The game gets old fast. There's no variation between save for what you do differently.◦ No 'special variants' of zombies. The enemies are monotonous.◦ No difficulty scaling based on the amount of players in game. It's virtually impossible to reach level 10 solo, but it's nearly impossible not to with three other people at your back.◦ No upgrades. At first glance, this may not seem like a big deal, but eventually the horde can break your steel palisades in a matter of seconds, and your laser can do nothing to stop it.◦ No progression. Once you die, that's it you start at square one again with nothing to show for it. There's a ranking system, but it doesn't mean a thing in the end.The Ugly◦ Overall, the visuals are adequate. It's not disappointing but it's certainly not impressive in any sense of the word.◦ The setting is... Nonexistant... There's one 'map' and it's a lamp post surrounded by an expanse of concrete.  ◦ There are only three character types and no customization whatsoever.The RealityThe game isn't bad by any means. I got it for 67 cents and don't regret the purchase. You get what you pay for; A couple hours of entertainment. While it's lacking in some ways, the features that are in place are, at the very least, executed well. If you're not impressed easily, there's little enjoyment to be had here, but if you're looking for some quick and inexpensive entertainment on the fly, it's definitely got you covered.

content:
Posted: February 23, 2015
												This was the best 75 cents of my entire life. For those who want a full review, read on. Otherwise, I give the game a 9/10 for a low price and fun gameplay.I found this game randomly, saw it was 75 cents for a two pack (ON SALE), and instantly got it thinking it would be only decent, but it's actually really good! This is a very simple game, and as such it is not very difficult to learn the different mechanics. As the title may suggest, this game is about defending yourself from zombies, but it's in a third person perspective and it's done pretty well overall. This game offers two gamemodes, which are Defense and Endless Night (which can be unlocked by getting to night 7 of Defense). The 3 characters are Guy, Girl, and Swat, and they do not (as far as I've seen) have any difference between them. I think it would be cool to add some special characteristics to make the characters different; such as the Guy having more Defense, the Girl having more Speed, and the Swat having more Damage or Firing Speed. Every Night in Defense mode you can buy upgrades like fences or weapons, and so you evolve from night to night. But as expected, the zombies slowly get more challenging too. This game is a masterpiece for the asking price of as little as 50 cents for a copy, and is still fun. For those who have that little amount of money in their steam wallet, I highly recommend getting this game. It's lots of fun.Yet Another Zombie Defense - 9/10
