content:
Posted: May 20, 2016
IntroductionYet Another Zombie Defense is a game which puts players versus zombies in a fight for survival on a very simple map. It's a very simple and straightforward top-down, arcadey shooter with a fairly large arsenal of weapons and defensive options to be used. There is a lot of fun to be had with this one, and has some very interesting stategic options to fit many playstyles. Read further to learn more.GameplayThe gameplay of YAZD (I'll refer to it by this acronym) is divided into three sections: Classic, Survival and Deathmatch. One common thing between these three is that the zombies get stronger and stronger over time, which means that no matter how hard you try, you're eventually going to die at some point though you can hold out for pretty long especially with a full 4-man squad. Speaking of which, this game supports a maximum of 4 players in any multiplayer game. Zombies drop ammo, money and power-ups for the player randomly when killed.ClassicYour goal is to survive each night from a horde of zombies that spawn. Each night has more zombies, and their defensive, offensive and mobility multipliers go higher every night meaning that survival is less and less likely each night. To your aid are weapons, pickups and the store. After you complete a night, you can shop from the store which randomly has items on sale. Money is an important resource which you collect from dead zombies, and can be the difference between an impenetrable defense and a failed run. Every few nights you get a skill point which can be allocated to upgrade one of the following: Movement speed, pickup range, health regeneration, health points or reload speed. It's important to identify which particular upgrade path suits your playstyle and stick to it. Survive long enough and you'll get to upgrade them all, but some upgrades are better than others early on. Defensive and Offensive options are plentiful and really cater to multiple strategic playstyles. Want to run around shooting zombies that chase you? Grab an automatic weapon like the uzi. Prefer to snipe out entire lines of enemies? Sniper Rifle. Need an effective area of effect weapon? Grab a rocket launcher or the tesla coil. The combinations are endless, but your money and ammo is not, so always think ahead.SurvivalThis time it's a race against the clock to see how long you can hold out from the endless wave of zombies chasing you. There is no shop here so the only thing that drops are weapons. Good luck collecting them though.DeathmatchI haven't played this one enough to give it a detailed review, but essentially you can now hurt other players whilst having to deal with zombies at the same time. I will update soon.VisualsYAZD doesn't really have much in the graphics department. It's not horrible on the eyes, but it's not very good either. The one map it has is very plain, and the edges of the map are simply black. A lot more could be done visually to give it a better feeling overall, but the devs may not go that direction.AudioThe soundtrack, while being okay, is repetitive and limited. Again, not much worth mentioning here. Summary & ConclusionYAZD is best played with your friends or anyone online for that matter. The fight for survival is a very fun experience, and can lead to some rather tense moments where you're struggling to keep your base from falling as the zombies close in. Playing solo is not really recommended, as there's much less zombie killing action to really enjoy, but you can if you want to. At the price it's easy to pick up and play, and it goes on sale quite often, so it's definitely worth your time and money. For what this game offers at its price:7/10 - Must...Survive...Another...NightIf you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up. You can also find more reviews over at http://www.completingthebackloggroup.com/Please also check out Completing the Backlog's Curator page here - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

												I was going to buy this game for myself when it was 75% off, but decided to instead buy 2 copies  so I could invite a friend. The small 133mb download made it so I could play with my friend in minutes. I can imagine that playing alone is boring, although me and my friend had a blast. There are only 3 gamemodes currently, defense, eternal night and deathmatch. Defense is really the only worthwile gamemode, with much needed improvements to the AI.Overall I like the games simplistic art style (although it feels very PlayStation 2 era) and would like to see improvements to A.I. and gamemodes. Definitely a good choice for a couple hours of fun (with friends). I give it a 9/11.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 9, 2016
												 When I first got into this game, it was half a dollar. For such a low price I expected a low quality game with no longevity whatsoever. Granted, I still think it may not provide the longevity some gamers long for(IT DOES HAVE REPLAY VALUE, but it is definitely fun.A simple zombie defense game, that doesn't require any additional effort to play online(like downloading Hamachi).Pros:-Few noticeable bugs(other than wanky character models)-Easy to host, connect, and randomly join your friends or random people-Can be played casually, but has a rather large skill gap because of the room for strategic play(That's a biggie for hardcore gamers)-Very simple concept   -Easy to get into-Very little PC power needed to run-Promotes cooperative play-Replay value-No additional effort for connecting to playersCons:-Inconsiderate, inept, worthless, wastes of oxygen(Scrub hosts).   -When playing online, all the money is shared amongst everyone, but only host can spend it, so that tends to result in      greedy misfortune   -There is no host migration feature(If the player hosting quits, the entire game ends)   -Does not promote playing with randoms   -There is a grace period between each zombie wave(which is nice), but if the host doesn't want a break, he gets to skip      the entire grace period. Not only that but there is a very small respawn delay for the zombies, so if you have the      misfortune of scrub-based matchmaking, you will not get a grace period(no time to speak in chat with other players) Overall, it is a great game, and for a low price, you can go sell a few trading cards and come back for it.I do highly recommend this game only if you play solo, with friends, or happen to find decent competent people.Thank you for reading, have a great life.

content:
Posted: January 7, 2016
												Very fun, simple game. I'm surprised this game isn't more popular, especially since it's so cheap. I would recommend buying this for yourself and friends because it's sometimes hard to play since not many people play. If you have your friends to play with, this would be much more fun. Sum of the game Max 4 players a game I highly suggest getting chainsaws for everyone. They're unlimited and kill very quickly up until wave 10~. This is a great way to save money for better weapons and defense.  Creator of a game controls all money picked up. You can click " Buy" on an item you request to have and it will say that you wish to have said item bought above your character Gun turrets can be useful, but are weak against being attacked. Be cautious having them unprotected Gun turrets are used by placing it and mounting it with a weapon that you have already purchased (it's unlimited ammo on turret as far as I know, with slowish fire rate?) Communicate by pressing "enter" A great strategy is to try and group the zombies together and kill them by following the edges of the map. Upgrade movement max for this to be best so they can't hit you Last three weapons seem to be the best. Blaster is great but may cause lag especially with multiple people.  I don't suggest getting the item-grabbing upgrade unless you reall need it.  Be mindful of what weapons you purchase. The more weapons you have, the more you have to switch weapons to get to one you want sometimes which is time consuming. I typically stick with 3 weapons (chainsaw, Tesla, Blaster)Pros: fast paced, lots of options for different strategies, simple to play, fun, nice graphics for being simple, smooth movement and shootingCons: not many people play, sometimes you freeze and can't move until you die, lag can be bad by around night 20 due to so many zombies and shooting, high rise in difficulty as you get to around 20, people don't chat and quit early, people may join your game and not agree how you spend money which may become problematic as a teamSome things I wish would be changed: upgradable weapons and barriers, option to change leader, minor glitches fixed (I've experienced two so far: one where the camera will stick and won't follow your character anymore and when your character freezes at the end of a round and either won't move or shoot until you die)

content:
Posted: January 28, 2015
												This game makes fun! You kite around a lantern and must survive several waves. On 4th wave you'll have enough money to buy a better weapon (I prefer the Sniper Rifle) or start to build up your camp. Therefore are wooden or steel palisades and turrets where you can mount all weapons.Every wave you evolve more. But the zombies do also. Each property of their damage, life and speed raises by a factor. There are even more effective weapons like a rocketlauncher, the tesla coil or a lasercannon, but the ammo is mostly too expensive or the reload time is quite too long. Another mode is the endless night mode. which you gain after 10 waves of survival. In endless night mode there are no palisades. Weapons spawn by random of killed zombies. Here you must survive 5 min max. The MP is stable and makes fun. Achievements are partly deactivated for MP. Don't miss this little but nice game. The devs have promised some more content if you support them.

content:
Posted: May 5, 2016
												The game is really fun, at least on defense mode, haven't tried the other modes yet. The player gets to build his shelter from zombies during the day and fight 'em during the night. Each zombie killed gives the player money reward plus they have a chance to drop extra cash and some other cool stuff.In defense mode the game requires the player to be wise and strategic in order to get equipped with good weapons for harder levels and to be able to save enough for good defences. Each purchasable item has a chance on becoming on sale randomly by a small amount noticed about 25% for each purchasable item for in-game money.The few minor defects about the game though:1. When purchasing the SMG weapon full price (not on sale) as well as the ammo, ammo shows the price for it - 60 but player gets deducted - 80. And when it's on sale it is the other way around, the cost displayed is 80, while actually deducting - 60.2. Some areas of the map is for some reason blocked from deploying mines, I wonder if that's intended or actual bug???Some features to be added would be great:- No explanation or strength of the defences. Would be nice to get some info about that.- Also the weapon stats would be good to have as well.Overall experience and rating: RecommendedAddictive, always making you reach for better score and earn more money to get better defenses and weapons.Personal opinion ratings:Gameplay: 8/10Graphics: 6/10Fun: 8/10Average 7/10

content:
Posted: November 21, 2016
												Gameplay is fun, recommend you to buy it when there's a sale on this title.Get your friends to buy the game during the sale, because all the fun in YAZD is in its multiplayer.What's disappointing is that you cannot buy weapons if you are not the host and if the host isn't buying them (quite a few of them happen to be ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s), then you are well and truly screwed. And if you are interested in conversing with teammates via team chat, then well, you can, but good luck mate. That♥♥♥♥♥♥is screwed too.In all, killing zombies is a good way to spend your spare time and if you are a fan of zombie movies (Shaun of the Dead, Zombieland, etc) and tv shows (The Walking Dead, In the Flesh,etc) like me and you would really not want to miss out on playing all the great/good/decent zombie games that exist, then get this when it's on sale.And hey, the game also has trading cards.

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												Before the first update:Buyers: OMG, the multiplayer is amazing. I only bought this game for the multiplayer because single player is just a white environment with loads of stalkers chasing you. Atleast in multiplayer I can do trick shots with friends with loads of different weapons.The first Update is released:Developers: Due to large amounts of trolling, only the host can buy the group weapons.Buyers: What the f*** is wrong with you guys? The only good thing about this game (excluding the trading cards) has been ruined. Now, the hosts troll you by only letting you use a s*** pistol. So you ask for a better gun. They ignore you. You ask again. They kick you from the server.Who's idea was it to apply this update because I'm making sure to never buy a game he/she has been involved in. Imagine how terrible games would be if this update was appled to them.Minecraft: You have to ask the host for a stickCall of duty: You have to rely on the host to give you the best gun that will obviously kill everyoneAlso, why is it called YET another zombie defense. I can only think of one more and that's boxhead. Actually, boxhead is probably better than this game.In short, remove the previous update, change the background and this will be a good game.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 21, 2015
												The basic of basic dual joystick shooters, Yet Another Zombie Defense sports a good tower defense challenge. Graphically, its not outstanding and its only ambience considered is a single lightpost among a dark, barren concrete wasteland. Despite it being beaten within the day, the replay value might be low, considering not much is left to be unexpected, except how long you can last. If you're looking for a quick and simple strategy game, look no further. But if it's the customization and creativity you're after, you might be disappointed, but willing to play for the low price.As an aside, the indie developers send you a message upon exiting the game for support and if you know anything about indie games, they deserve their time in the limelight.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2014
												Yet Another Zombie Defense is a zombie survival game with co-op and uses the wave mechanics.I think it's well worth 1.99£ (right now it's 0,67£!) because it's so much fun.Here's my positives and negatives.Positives+ Very fun to play+ Achievements+ Wide variety of weapons+ 2 game modes and both are fun to play+ Co-op+ Unlimited time to prepare for the next waveNegatives(for a game of this price I really can't demand more than they've given so this is more like stuff I'd like them to have)- Boring environment- Only one kind of zombiesNote this though, to be able to enjoy this game you're almost required to have a friend to play it with. I have a hard time seeing myself being able to play it alone and enjoy it, but with a friend it's great fun. You can always make friends in the co-op mode, there is a chat option. 8/10 (considering the price)

Some weird♥♥♥♥♥♥again then i bought it on a sale for 50 cents + bought my 2 friends one So i spent 1.70 euros +-This game isn't as stupid as it looks, its way better give it a try its pretty cheap.The choice of weapons is really high and you really need strategy hereThe dificulity, it depends wether your good at strategy or not...For me its hard i suck at strategy but i still love this game+ Has much choice of weapons and baricades.+ Isn't easy, needs strategy...+ An "endless night" mode if you really dont like strategy and like some action :D+ Graphics OUTSTANDING 11/9 -IGN (This is a joke the graphics arent that good but it fits the game :D)-/+ You need some skill of strategy -/+ You can use the same tactic all the time since the lvls and money isnt really randomly generated- Can get boring really quick...- Really a few buggs that were annoying.. OVERALL RATING So far i would give this game a 9/10Pretty simple and if your looking for a quick and funny game to enjoy with your friends, recommended for you.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2016
												After playing a decent 6 hours of what i consider to be the greatest masterpiece of modern times, it is safe to say that YAZD is the best RPG,Shooter,Strategy and adult video game. The game itself is the pinnacle of tactical shooters, rivaling games such as Arma 3, and Battlefield 1 through to 4. Its RPG nature allows it to surpass games wuch as The Witcher and Mass Effect. And to top it all off the strategy aspect feels like it came straight out of lego star wars the clone wars battle mode. I purchased this gem for 99 cents and bought it for a friend. We play it every chance we get and it is continues to serve as an excellent option when there is nothing else to play. All that is missing a competitive scene for YAZD, I already class myself as in the top 5 players in the world as my skill with the tesla gun rivals the awping of KennyS so when the dev does add it, it will pro long this titles life span for another 10 hours.In conclusion YAZD is the pinnacle of gaming, it the finest example of how a game is done right. So I highly encourage all to purchase and play this game I rate it 9 keemstars out 10.

content:
Posted: October 4, 2015
												I will rate the two primary factors to this game (Gameplay and Sound) and include a final score below.__________________________________________-Gameplay 8/10 (Very Good)The premise of the game is to survive wave after wave of zombies that increase in Toughness (health), Damage, and Speed. Each kill you earn is money in your pocket, and they regularly drop pick-ups from ammo, limited power-ups, and bonus cash. After each wave you have the chance to build barricades, guns, or turrets to mount guns. After a certain amount of kills, the player can choose from a tier list of upgrades including but not limited to: Reload Speed, Run Speed, Health Regen. After beating a minimum of 7 waves, the player can now play endless night mode in which the entire game is spent during the zombie phase and you progress by picking up weapons the zombies drop and pray to God you won't die.The difficulty in this game is incredibly high. Getting passed early waves is easy but your choice in purchases will impact how far you can get in the long wrong. There's a limit to the amount of money you can make each round, and it's up to RNG to decide how many drops of bonus cash you can get to help buy those extra barricades or that final turret. The micromanagement of your cash is probably the most engaging part of the game, but as most defence games work this way this becomes an incredibly fun part about the game. Zombies have a one track mind and will do everything they can to get their hands on you, and their spawns are quite methodical as they will appear to surround you within a second with only one way out. It's very bullet-hell-ish.The Multiplayer aspect of the game is spot-on and has virtually no issues other than minor connectivity problems that seldom appear.-Sound 5/10 (Average)The audio in this game is quite cheap. The song that plays on loop is bland, landing itself on the sweet spot of, "This is a constant loop but it's not annoying so I can tune it out white noise." The weapon sounds feel like an after thought, like the developers forgot that they needed sound the entire time and made quick sounds, leveled them so they weren't abnoxiously loud, and then released the product a little early. However, like the music, they're on a sweet spot of comfortable absence.FINAL SCORE........... 7/10 (Good)__________________________________________Rating System:10 - Fantastic9 - Great8 - Very Good7 - Good6 - Fine5 - Average4 - Bad3 - Very Bad2 - Horrible1 - Apalling

content:
Posted: April 25, 2014
												My first impression when I booted up this game is to harvest for cards. Well I decided to give it a shot and to my surprise, I find myself enjoying it! I was laughing the whole time I was playing it. It's the multiplayer mode that this game really shines! It can apparently go up to 4 in the co-op. You can drop in any random game that's going on over the world. This game starts with you standing next to a lamp post, and you must defend yourself from various hordes of zombies coming at you, spread out into waves or "nights" as the game calls it. They get harder to kill as it progresses, but after each wave you get to buy upgrades. There's a healthy variety of weapon selection. Here, the fun is building the barriers to delay the zombies, and turrets which let you mount various weapons on it. They can break if suffered enough damage from the zombies. I played co-op in a few games, and you gotta love chatting up with these random people and the creative ways to defend from the zombie hordes using the barriers and turrets. That made for a least 1 hour of fun, which is well worth the asking price. Definitely feel that more upgrades e.g. health, reload speed, perks can be added into the game (a la Crimsonland), but then it would be just a dime a dozen top-down shooter.Pros: fun co-op, comes with steam trading cards and achievements  Cons: lacklustre graphics and music, only 1 level design with 1 type of enemy, oddly enough only the host of the game can buy upgrades.

content:
Posted: October 29, 2014
												Zombiedefense with basebuilding - Turrets, barricades. Yep, should be enough to get you goin and buy this game.But well, heres what I experienced. GameplayShooting feels very smooth, zeds get fast very strong and you need to get the best weapons asap. You can put every weapon on your turrets so there are a lot of combinations to experiment. The walking animation of the playable survivors look a bit...strange. The legs are swinging around in the air like you are swimming, no idea. MultiplayerSorry but no matter what game I join, I have such incredible lags that its basically unplayable. Endless ModeSo there was a patch recently adding a new gamemode called endless.Too bad something went incredibly wrong with this mode, since it doesnt make any sense to shoot at the zeds, they spawn endless and you wont be able to pick up the loot they drop because else you will die. When you play the endless mode it will look like this: You run around in a circle kiting the zeds around at the edge of the map trying to not get sandwiched. Shooting doesnt make any sense. Im not sure if this is the mode we want to play...Dont know how endlessmode looks in multiplayer, but at least thats what you get in SP.

DIE ZOMBIE DIE!A very good game for such a cheap price, some features are missing but I couldn't complain because this is a small indie game.So you're thrown into the game straight away there's no story it's simply just a survival game with the object being either survive as many nights as you possibly can by building up your fort with the money you earn from killing zombies and picking up loot drops, or to try out the gamemode "Endless Night" where you never stop fighting zombies!Features:- The game ran smoothly with lots of events and animations happening.- The achievements to unlock make the game more challenging!- Multiplayer can be setup very easily for either friends only to join you or for you to let anyone looking to play online join you in on your game.- Zombie difficulty scales up each night.- The odd chance a zombie could drop a bonus timed boost for you.- There's a RPG leveling system for certain player skills (more playstyles).- Controls for both controller and mouse and keyboard.Missing Features:- Customizable characters.- Different types of zombies.- A few public servers where everyone could connect and play (no private match servers).- Players inventorys/weapons were independant in multiplayer not the hosts inventory.- Some different maps, random maps maybe?Another than that I really like the game and I would suggest it if you're looking for something to kill time with either on your own or with a friend, well worth the cheap price!

												Game: Yet Another Zombie DefenseDeveloper: Awesome Game StudiosRelease Date: 28th March 2014This is a game i had not heard about for an extremely long time until i found it as a two pack for £0.39 so i bought it for me and a friend. 												~OUTDATED REVIEW~-About the game:Don't listen to the others. They don't have enough hours on the game. Like 0.2 most of them. This game is totally fun! The SinglePlayer is awesome, and the Co-op is great! Try this game! It also has achievements and trading cards. -About the community:The community is big, not very big, but has enough people playing the game. And the greates thing is that you can post new improvements you want in the game, on the forums. The developer (a very nice guy) is reading them and responding about what he will add in the game. The developer is constantly making updates. So feel free to post new ideas! -About the guys who reviewed this as a crap game:Guys, you'll find out this will become a great game. More graphic options, weapons, characters, maps will be added soon.Just buy this game and have fun! You can enter the forums and find some nice guys to play with in Co-op mode. Also, a new mode will be added in the next update, so feel free to check this game out, and post your opinions here!

Posted: April 24, 2014
												Well I just played with some tactical russian guy. It's fun to play alone or with friends/random people. But the game needs some configuration, because ALL PLAYERS share the ammo/cash, game should give players to keep things to their own. I played only 3~ hours of this game so far. I don't know how about anybody else, but it was fun to play over and over to get some of the achievements. Well after I quit the game there was a pop-up message that said if I'll rate it up and give positive feedback, devs will add more content (free DLC'S beaches!), so... why the F not? (I mean I enjoyed the game). Keep up the good work! I wonder what other game modes could be O-O, I hope I'll live to see it lol xD. content:
Posted: April 28, 2014
												Im gonna be rating this game by grades and on different categories:Graphics,Main Objective,Gameplay,Weapons.A = EXTREMELY GOOD!B=really goodC=DecentD=mehE=badF=horribleThe graphics deserve a C (decent) good model texturing,lighting...The main objective is pretty much to survive (the way i like) i have to give it a B,there couldve been more added to the main objective,like protect an NPC for as long as you can (president,injured civillian,soldier,cop,etc...)The gameplay is C it is very interesting,the zombies can overwhelm you quickly and the weapons are cool,but there couldve been some more kinds of defence props,like barrels,electric fences,spikes maybe even a flogger (if you played Shi No Numa in Call of Duty:World at War)Ahhh the last one...weapons! now THAT is a pure A.The veriaty of weapons is AMAZING! shotgun,assault rifle,flame thrower...wow they even have a ****ing laser cannon!They couldve added a minigun but i don´t mind,it´s still a cool game.Entire Game Rating =B! really good! the graphics could have been better and they could have put some more work into the game,otherwise is amazing and worth your 1,99€!Buy in the store now,tell em ClassyDerp sent ya!

content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												This game is a lot of fun, but there are some small drawbacks. With the current defense placement system, it can be extremely tedious to add and remove defenses while still retaining your sanity. Also, because the bodies don't disapear until the next wave, the game sometimes lags once you get to the point where you have 100s of bodies on the screen at one time. If the way you place defenses gets tweaked and the bodies fade away after they die it would be perfect.

												I bought the two pack for 74 cents... definitely worth my money. Although this game could use quite a bit of improvement, it is very fun to play with friends and gets challenging after night 20. content:
Posted: August 28, 2015
												This game makes me happy not only on the outside, but on the inside as well. When I play this game, I get super excited as I slay evil zombies. The zombies make me scared to go to sleep, and I get suicidal. My parents as well as my doctors have to be in the room as I play this game, otherwise they fear I will kill myself because of how sp00ked I am of the zombies. 												Im gonna be rating this game by grades and on different categories:Graphics,Main Objective,Gameplay,Weapons.A = EXTREMELY GOOD!B=really goodC=DecentD=mehE=badF=horribleThe graphics deserve a C (decent) good model texturing,lighting...The main objective is pretty much to survive (the way i like) i have to give it a B,there couldve been more added to the main objective,like protect an NPC for as long as you can (president,injured civillian,soldier,cop,etc...)The gameplay is C it is very interesting,the zombies can overwhelm you quickly and the weapons are cool,but there couldve been some more kinds of defence props,like barrels,electric fences,spikes maybe even a flogger (if you played Shi No Numa in Call of Duty:World at War)Ahhh the last one...weapons! now THAT is a pure A.The veriaty of weapons is AMAZING! shotgun,assault rifle,flame thrower...wow they even have a ****ing laser cannon!They couldve added a minigun but i don´t mind,it´s still a cool game.Entire Game Rating =B! really good! the graphics could have been better and they could have put some more work into the game,otherwise is amazing and worth your 1,99€!Buy in the store now,tell em ClassyDerp sent ya!

My chainsaw appeared.Like as If I was God or something.Then I continued to play the game.In the end I totally forgot about the friend I "Going" to play with.Cons: Not much buildings nor weps.Not such a active game.Zombies go bonkers when all players are dead (In endless night)Chat is a bit small in windowed mode.not much.Pros!Good time waster,Enough to make you focused on the game,Fun with friends, (and  r e t a r d s     t h a t    c a n   n o t  r e a d !)Rip: Me

content:
Posted: March 28, 2014
												Let's get a few things out of the way: Yes it is a port of the Xbox 360 Indie Game, which doesn't automatically make it a bad game. In fact the Indie section of the Xbox Arcade Marketplace has some amazing titles like Beat Hazard, Nyan Cat Adventure, DLC Quest, Any of the Avatar Based Games and plenty more. Yes it's another zombie shooter with tower defense elements. But it's still a fun game. In fact, it reminded me alot of a flash game I used to play called Boxhead: The Zombie Wars. It controls well with the WASD or Arrow Keys, aim with the mousem, and you can shoot with either the Left-Mouse Button or the Space Bar. There's a nice selection of weapons to choose from...except don't bother with the FlameThrower. It seems to be the weakest of the bunch seeing as I rarely got any kills from it.Are there flaws with the game? Well yes. For one thing I wish there was a weapon upgrade system in the shop between rounds and a bit more turret styles and defensive placements. Graphics are a bit meh at best, but coming from a two-man indie team, you shouldn't expect FarCry 3 level of graphics. The option menu is a bit lacking, but seeing as I only browse it to see if it has a fullscreen on-or-off button (which it does!), it didn't really bother me.All and all, I recommend this game for anyone who wants a simple yet fun zombie survival game.

content:
Posted: May 13, 2015
												Main game ini sambil dengerin music nya memang BEST lah. Sayangnya,  environment di game ini sangatlah sedikit, ya dikit banget, cuma ada lapangan + tiang lampu doank. Kan lebih bagus kalau ada tambahan kayak mobil yang bisa meledak kalau di tembak, tong minyak dan lain sebagai-nya.Untuk Multiplayer nya masih aktif, dan tadi sempet main, gak ngelag, stabil. Sebagai Host, kita nanti yang bakal beliin item atau weapon untuk anggota party. Nah, di game ini ada Achievement yang MASIH BISA KITA CAPAI. Yap, gampang. Gak seperti kebanyakan game lain yang memiliki tingkat kesulitan yang amat sangat susah untuk mencapai Achievement nya.Game ini juga ada drop card yang memiliki harga lumayan.Sebelum kita main atau melanjut kan misi di "Night " selanjut nya, kita nanti bakalan beli weapon atau item item yang lumayan fun untuk membasmi zombie seperti shotgun, chainsaw, turret, flame thrower dan lain sebagainyaCash yang kita dapat dari membunuh zombie tersebut.Saya belum menjumpai adanya sistem Boss di game ini. Masih stuck di Night 10 .Well, nilai saya 7/10. Untuk kalian yang ingin menyicip game horror yang memacu adrenalin, lebih baik jangan beli game ini. Game ini lebih di tujukan ke Survival, dan have fun dalam multiplayernya ~Hingga sekarang belum pernah sampai ke Night 10 ~ :') Damn

												It's an award winning blockbuster Xbox One exclusive tier game that makes Mass Effect 3s ending look like the Teletubbies. It's got the top of the line super streamed turbo graphics which is best viewed with the all powerful computing might of wireless monitors features 3D so real it's may as well be real life 2. It's got the game and the play. It's mechanics not quite unlike the 2014 blockbuster Call of Duty Zombie Ghosts GOTY featured in E3 with Xbox One Kinect. And it's got an emotionally moving story that will bring you to tears and make Passion of the Christ look like a baby movie for real.Halo: Spartan Assault brings the excitement of Halo combat to Steam for the very first time. Battle your way through 30 action-packed missions against the Covenant as you explore the origin of the Spartan Ops program featured in Halo 4. Earn Steam achievements, complete missions and compete against your friends for the top scores in the leaderboards. It's time to join the assault, Spartan! You should buy this and support Hitler the end.

												UPDATE TWO: More items have been added and a few other fixes were implemented. The game is perfectly stable now as far as I can tell. The net code was improved. More items have been added and I still can't recommend it. Get Zombo Busters instead.UPDATE: The game has been updated with "Endless Night" mode and 3 achievements to go with it. It's buggy and crashed twice while I unlocked it [beating wave 10, which I had done forever ago, but had to do again] The new game mode itself is boring and doesn't last more than five minutes maximum. The item drops don't have any indication of when they will despawn. This game was, and still is, completely bland.This is hardly a game.Starcraft custom maps are more innovative.It should have been included as a mode or a mini-game in some other game...At least they only charge $2.

number of helpful: 8 of 17 people (47%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 20, 2014
												Based on the title alone, it is obvious what this game is like.  Hordes of zombies are trying to get you, and you need to fend them off as long as possible.  While this sounds like most other zombie games, this game is as simple as that.  Other games like Left 4 Dead or All Zombies Must Die have you fighting mobs of zombies, they mix things up by doing things like escort and fetch mission.  With this game, fighting waves of zombies is the only thing you do.  When the current wave is gone, the next wave begins.  After only one wave, you will see everything the game has to offer.  With no variety at all, it hardly makes playing worth it.Another problem with the game is the scenery.  With the mentioned games above, there is plenty of variety even from the beginning.  Yet is about as bland is it could be.  The only thing you will see is a single lamppost.  Move even a little bit away from it, and the game becomes almost too dark to see clearly.  Even if the game was well lit, beyond the lamppost, there is literally nothing else to see.  There are no barriers, buildings, or holes whatsoever.  There is nothing else to see at all.  With nothing to see, you may as well be playing blind.What should be a bright spot about the game is the multiplayer.  However, it does not take long before the monotony of the game sets it even with others.  Even when playing with friends, the bland gameplay will overwhelm you faster than the zombies can.  It will take at most ten minutes before the desire to play something better kicks in.This game just does not have one good thing going for it.  The low price tag might make it as tempting impulse purchase, but when the game starts, regret over wasting money will overtake you.

number of helpful: 8 of 17 people (47%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 30, 2014
												It's Nation Red if you sucked all the fun and life out of it.  Only one map with a single street lamp during the night time on boring grey pavement.  Waves of zombies attack that will randomly drop cash and ammo and health boosts.  After each wave you buy weapons/ammo, repeat as the waves get increasingly more difficult.  It's very barebones, but the price fits the quality.  I'd much rather recommend Nation Red than this if you are looking for a game of this nature.

content:
Posted: April 13, 2014
												There is only one type of zombie, the graphics are stone-age and still manages to run at terrible speed. You are better off not even building anything other than a few turrets defended by walls, so that whole system is thrown out. The soundtrack isn't a soundtrack, and more like one song that is the most irritating and annoying song repeated over and over again, each time with a scream that can only be described as a poor soul who had to play this game. There is also the fact that when playing with others, only the game maker can build/buy anything. That includes barricades, turrets, guns, and gun ammo. Also there is the fact that there are only 3 things you can build: wood and metal barricades and a turret, and if my memory serves me right there are only 7 guns.I played a game similar to this on the DSi that was better than this. Not the 3DS, the DSi, and is better than a PC game made recently. This can only be described as a crappy attempt by an indie team trying to pander to that 10 year-old audience that is obsessed with zombie games, and is a sleezy cash grab. Don't waste the $2, and go buy a candy bar or something.

												The old saying "you get what you pay for" rings true for this gem.I got it for free from a giveaway on Steamgifts.I shall now make it my lifelong goal to track down the gifter and kick his dog.***Ok seriously, this is a poor man's version of Nation Red. A very poor man indeed. Nation Red is regularly on sale for the same price this game was released at. Even better, 5 years after release, Nation Red got an update that added new material. Nation Red has: more guns, more zombies, more variety, better music, more levels, cooler achievements, and funner overall gameplay. Yeah the two games aren't exactly comparable, but if you are even remotely thinking of buying this game . . . don't.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 6, 2014
												No, just no.Stay far away from this game. It's pretty horrible and boring.There's: one map (with a lamppost in the middle of it), one type of zombie (which sometimes rushes you), one sound track (which gets old after the first thirty second loop).At the end of every round the zombie count is upped and the zombies take more shots to kill. This continues until you die. "Fun"I can't say many games aren't worth $2... but this isn't. Not even close.Co-op might make the game better, but how could I ever recommend any of my friends to buy it?You could make this game (minus the networking) in Unity for free in about a weekend.On the plus side, the developer seems to be very active in trying to make the game better.If the game were "Early Access" I think it would easier to not be so negative, but this game is so minimal that it's not really a game. It's not completed. It would have been better to keep from releasing and added at least one more level and a few more zombie types. This just gets boring really quickly.If you want to see how this type of game is done correctly, go buy and play Nation Red.It's 5x the price, but 20x the game.Just... no.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 10, 2014
												YAZD is the standard "Zombie Defense" gimmick (as made obvious by the title), But there's really only so much enjoyment you can get out of this gimmick, and YAZD just fails to entertain me. I, as many others only bought YAZD because I got a 90% coupon for it. Honestly, YAZD's one of the very few games that I hold Buyers Remorse over. I've spent roughly seven minutes in this game to-date, And in those seven minutes I managed to figure out pretty much the entire game.The gameplay is fairly standard: You are a survivor with a supply of weapons (That you for some reason must purchase) who mindlessly slaughters zombies. Most of the game is spent holding down the Left Mouse Button and strafing around the zombies, And at later stages even strafing becomes useless when the zombies get faster. There are two barricades you can purchase (which I found wildly useless) and a sentry gun (Mildly helpful, But you have to relinquish one of your weapons for it).The graphics (Yes, I know graphics aren't eveything, But still.) are subpar, from the character animations to the lazily done Single level. There's nothing impressive about the barren level, and the only scenery on the SINGLE LEVEL is one lamppost, Which even then has completely terrible lighting.The UI has a rookie feel to it, With current ammo being a confusing yellow bar and health being the standard red bar, Money is displayed in a green font. Honestly, The UI isn't really bad, though that may just be the minimal amount of elements to it.For droppable items, there is a very scant amount of them: Ammo, Health, and extra Money pick-ups. Ammo is fairly obvious along with money, But health just gives you full health off the bat. All three are displayed with the generic sprites that you've seen everywhere.And for sound; I can't really complain about weapon noises or zombie sounds, As you can't really make "correct" sounds for them. But the music is just not good, It doesn't sound like you're in a zombie apocalypse, fighting for your life. And with that, There's no ambiance (though, That's probably because of the lack of scenery, Not really the musician's fault).Overall, I honestly cannot reccomend YAZD to anyone in good faith. To me, It feels more like an indie-startup's first project than a full fledged game. I personally feel that $2 is too much for a game where there's nothing but an established gimmick. I sorely regret impulse-buying YAZD just because I saw the price. Oh well though.

content:
Posted: January 9
												It does what it says on the tin. It is another zombie defense shooter.But the "building" mechanics don't make this game look more appealing than other zombie shooters, nor the rest of the game is fleshed out enough to make it stand among others.The menus aren't well organized; you can't leave the pause menu with ESC, the options menu is bare bones, the purchase menu is laid across the screen borders and hard to navigate on high-res monitors. In generals it feels like it was designed to be used with a controller.The graphics are not that great but it's not that important; however the character movements feel a bit off, and I've yet to figure out if it is the game in and of itself, or it's due the "upgrade system".It is mildly entertaining and rewarding, it's also very cheap, but if you ask me, I cannot recommend you this game.I'd rather play Nation Red.

content:
Posted: November 9, 2015
												An indie game that is very obviously not able to walk yet. I frankly don't know why it's available for purchase in its current state and, apparently, not marked as an Early Access game. The reason I'm writing this is because opening the menu while you're playing removes the HUD. It pauses the game and removes all the text from the screen. Just...wow. The menu options are still there, you just can't see them. After some frantic clicking and mashing the keyboard, it thanked me for subscribing to their newsletter, but I was unable to unpause the game. That and several other bugs and missing features simply don't make this game worth any money at this point.

content:
Posted: April 25, 2016
												Perhaps the best game ever made. I had been chasing after a professional career in DotA 2 but this game managed to show me how little I really knew about competitive gaming. The strats go way beyond anything I have ever encountered in a video game. Who could forget the brilliant roster of three heroes, each oozing personality in a way I have never seen in any MOBA? My favorite hero is SWAT bloke because he's pretty cool tbh fam. I look forward to the many years of competitive play this game will provide me.

content:
Posted: May 16, 2016
												Really great game, very cheap game it should be priced higher (imo). The gameplay is basic but flawless you have to survive waves and waves of zombies by using different weapons which are a ton different than each other. You might think the game is easy but after about 14 rounds it can get really hard especially alone. I recommend playing it with friends as in the game gets harder over time. Getting those achievements can be really tricky as finishing all these is actually a real challenge. Some complaints I have from the game are that some weapons are kind of the same as in: (laser=sniper)(blaster=shotgun) Their basically stronger versions of these weapons but have different particle effects. But still the game is very nice and I recommend anyone to play it. you don't have to like zombies or defense games its just the best game ever. I kinda get triggered lol whenever my mate loses the game. This game is also hilarious it has led to many different hilarious journeys with my friend. I recommend playing endless night mode with a pistol only. Lol just try doing that. Try getting to round 15 with the pistol only :).8.5/10 Make more diverse weapons and its 10/10 m8

Posted: June 23, 2015
												well... where do i startyet another zombie defence is a cheap, pretty pointless game on steam. here are the pors and consPROS.it's a zombie game.you can buy difrent weapons to defend your home.you can build a basewith that being said, here are the consCONS.there's not much building materials.the games not detailed well [you fight the zombies on a sea of concrete].the map is tiny.the playermodels look really ugly.if you build a base that completely goes around you, you will be stuck and cannot get out. .no jump buttonthe game needs much more map detail like maybe some props or something like that. a few more weapons would be nice and much more building materials like maybe sandbags or barbed wire or even a guard tower wich would be pretty awsome. i do not recomend this game bt if you need a simple game to kill time when you are bored, try yet another zombie defense. i hope this review was helpfull

content:
Posted: December 31, 2015
												Simplicity meets epic moments!    What can I say, I'm tired of the FPS, MMORPG, RTS, games.  I look for a game that I can sit down, play for 15 minutes to an hour, have epic saves, and fails. Wash my hands of it, and not feel like i've just wasted a bunch of time because something unexpected yanked me away.   All the old school gamers (80's-90's) will really appreciate  this game.  LAN parties (if there is such a thing anymore) would have been so epic with this.  10/10 in my books, and with the sale right now, a two pack is only $0.82.  Drop $10.00 and send one to all your friends, you won't regret it.

content:
Posted: April 25, 2016
												Perhaps the best game ever made. I had been chasing after a professional career in DotA 2 but this game managed to show me how little I really knew about competitive gaming. The strats go way beyond anything I have ever encountered in a video game. Who could forget the brilliant roster of three heroes, each oozing personality in a way I have never seen in any MOBA? My favorite hero is SWAT bloke because he's pretty cool tbh fam. I look forward to the many years of competitive play this game will provide me.

content:
Posted: September 13, 2016
												I bought 4 copies of this game, one for myself and 3 for my friends. I got it a couple months back for 49 cents each. Every cent was worth it. One of the most fun games to play with your friends. Just mess around and shoot zombies for a while. What's even better, my friends would troll each other by making a massive hoard chase around one guy, which in the end, he would get surrounded and mauled to death. Hilarious. The gameplay may not be amazing, but the laughs you will get will be worth it. However, I would like to warn people; DO NOT BUY FOR FULL PRICE! The game may be fun to play with friends, but it isn't worth a cent over 49. Here's why:Pros:A lot of fun with friends.Zombie mechanics and gun mechanics make for funny gameplay.Forts are fun to build and get trapped in, and be laughed at by your friends.Very well optimized and absolutely zero bugs.Very easy to connect with friends.Cons:Very amateur.Not fun in solo.Extremely rare updates.I highly recommend Skype for playing with friends (when they are at their homes), it just makes the experience better.Overall, 10/10.P.S. I will be buying more copies of the game if the price drops below 49 cents during a sale.

												Curator Review:Yet Another Zombie Defense, made by indie game developer Awesome Games Studios, is a rather simple game. Priced at only $2, YAZD is definitely what you pay for, a simple zombie defense game. While the game performs well it is ultimately lacking any sort of depth. The game is exactly what you would expect for $2 and while it is fun for about an hour or so I don't recommend this game. 6/10

Posted: December 21, 2014
												I bought this game not really expecting a lot. I'd bought a 2-pack so i had a friend to play with. But damn was it fun. This game is excellent when in the company of others. Nothing quite beats blasting away at hordes of zombies with a mate. The music and graphics are great for this low-priced gem and the devs are even better; they will update their game, with NO DLC. NO DLC! Finally a game company understands the point in buying a game! You get the whole thing for the price you pay!!! Though it does feature its downfalls in that the space in which you fight is as bland and featureless as a flattened potato. The difficulty curve also has a major spike after about night 4. Still, this is an enjoyable little game to waste half an hour on with your friends.7/10 A nice adition to any game library.

content:
Posted: August 27, 2015
												The game is a fun concept with some RPG elements (upgrading speed, reload time, pick up distance, etc.) and for $2 is hard to complain but man, the game is fundemantally flawed. The hitbox detection is the main issue,  as soon as a zombie raises it's arm to hit you, you're taking damage, no matter the distance you get away from it. The other issue is that for whatever reason the framerate is abysmal for me, my computer is no powerhouse but I'm running much more demanding games on it with no issue. Two things that are hard to overlook, for that, I don't recommend it.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2015
												10/10 rotten banana's - IGN"Best game of 1015" - The Times"It's like Skyrim with guns" - The Washington post"This game just keeps you wanting more.. or less.." - MeObjective, run around in circles hoping you can regen faster than the zombies can run.Survived your first night? good boy, now spend your money buying barricaides that you can walk thru and zombies can break within seconds.Got some left over cash? of course you dont, but lets say you do, go ahead and buy yourself a turret, but dont stop there, the turret needs a gun, and very exspensive ammo. You have even more money? Well now im calling you a liar, but okay! Go ahead and by yourself a gu- what do you mean you just di- what do you mean a zom- calm down dude its only just a g- HEY THAT'S MY MONIT-.You basically run around trying not to get hit by zombies and spam click your mouse.The aiming is horrid and so is the building machanics if you could call them that.After you kill a zombie they have a chance to drop extra cash, ammo, etc.At the end of the day once you killed all the zombies you get to spend the money buying barriciades, wooden, reinforced, electrofied, even one with a propiane tank in it.You can also buy a turret and a turret mark II. The turrets require you to purshase a gun and manually mount it to the turret, you then need to buy ammo for the gun which runs out really quickly, on round 10 it takes around $5000 of assualt rifle ammo to make a turret last the round.Did i mention the whole time your running around or trying to keep zombies off the barricaides they are breaking them and ignoring you? they target the most exspensive things first.You can glitch and go threw corners or barriciades, (and so can the zombies).When you throw a grenade you pause and cannot move for 3ish seconds and you have no control of where your guy throws the grenade.Every two days you get to pick a upgrade that helps you survive longer, extra health, regen, walk speed, etc.The public online mode of also horrid, unless your the host you cant build, buy, or pickup items. All you can do i shoot using the same starter pistol with infinite bullets that takes 2 clips to kill a zombie with.There are also a few powerups that drop that make you invisable for a short time or make you reload faster for a couple seconds.Also you get to choose from 'Guy' 'Girl' and 'SWAT' as playable characters.But for the price its a well made game and it will probably kill a few minutes of bordem or maybe a few hours if you get creative with a few friends.

content:
Posted: May 23, 2014
												I've read the negative reviews, and I understand them completely. This is a very basic game. Just point and click. Hell, you don't even have to keep clicking, you just need to hold down the left mouse button and watch devestation unfold. However, I recommend this game for two reasons. 1.) It's only 2 dollars. It costs less than most games on your cell phone. 2.) It's nostalgic. I don't remember how many times, be it in high school or even college, that I would play certain tower defense games that just involved pointing and clicking. (Hover over enemy, click them X number of times and watch them die) I love games like that. They are simple, to the point, and can bring hours of fun. Not to mention that you can play this game ONLINE with your friends or with anyone else who just happens to be on the game. True, there aren't too many weapons right now and it's also true that after you hit a million points it just sort of gets repetitive. But hey, what do you expect from something that costs less than a soda? This is one of those games that has many options for future developement. I really look forward to new weapons, new enemies, who knows what else might come. Also, one more perk about this game. It's a very small install size. It downloads fast and installs fast; and you don't need to worry about it soaking up your space like other games do.

content:
Posted: April 30, 2014
												Edit- Game is dead, cant recomend it. It was barely updated since release, and this was long ago.Dont get it wrong. Yet Another Zombie Defense isn't that bad. Really.The problem with the new reviews is that they care too much about things that doesnt affect in the gameplay itself -like "bad graphics" - I really hate when someone makes a review of a game, and put "bad graphics" as one of the cons. Graphics DOESN'T make good any game. Gameplay do. Fun do.Ok, we know that the game is repetitive, yes, it is. But, what you must consider is: The developers are working right now to put more weapons, zombies, and even a perk system. If this was the problem, you wont have it anymore. My guess is: They made the game, but didnt expected the game to sell well, and it did. Now, they see how much the game sold, and want to make it better, bigger. Remember, its a Indie game. Consider play with friends. Playing alone can make the game boring - unless you like the style (like me). Wait for further updates, the game is really cheap, and I absolutly not regret buying it.

number of helpful: 17 of 36 people (47%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 30, 2014
												Disclaimer: I received this game for free by signing up for Awesome Games Studio's newsletter. Receiving this game for free will in no way influence how I will review it.Yet Another Zombie Defense's title tries to joke around about the oversaturation of zombie shooters in recent years. However, I feel that the developers of this game simply wanted to name the game this way simply to make this joke, and hope that people buy it solely based around that one joke, but put little effort into fine-tuning the game itself. The game itself isn't terrible; the main issue is that it gets very boring, very quickly. There is no variation in gameplay; it's just a generic point-and-shoot horde mode. And a boring, generic game is not a joke I want to laugh at.The player (or players, in co-op mode) selects one of three character models (a man, a woman, and a SWAT officer), and is simply plunked into the only level in the game: a plain gray square with a single lamppost in the center. You must fight off zombies as long as possible, until your inevitible demise. When you defeat each wave, you will enter the day phase, where you can buy weapons, ammo, and barriers. There is no plot to speak of; no joking about other generic zombie shooters, no calling out the popularity of the undead in the media. It's just you versus the horde.Gameplay, as I mentioned before, is simple: point a gun at the zombies, shoot the zombies until they keel over dead, buy new things. Lather, rinse, repeat. There's nothing wrong with having a simple approach like this. However, if there isn't any variation in fighting off the zombies (like, say, new enemy types, moving to new locations, or doing other objectives like saving distressed survivors or fighting off bandits), then the game gets tedious very quickly. The only thing that might make people constantly play this game is to see if they can beat their high score, or to earn Achievements.Everything else about this game is also mind-numbingly boring and awkward. The character animations are quite awkward (especially the player characters), and seem to only consist of two frames each, with "faster" zombies speeding up said two frames. Death animations are just the dead character faceplanting into the ground. The weapon animations are also uninspired, but special mention goes to the flamethrower, which just shoots a small stream of orange circles at the zombies, with no flame animation on the afflicted mobs. It also appears that the zombies can hit you the second they start their attack animation, even if you move just out of their attack range as it begins.Speaking of weapons, they don't feel like they dealt much damage against the hordes. The pistol feels like a cheap water pistol, the flamethrower is hilariously ineffective against large mobs of zombies, and the SMG feels like a rapid fire version of the pistol. I usually stuck with the shotgun and the rocket launcher, as these two seemed to be the only two weapons that dealt a significant amount of damage to the horde, killing zombies in 1 to 2 shots. If you're good at moving around the screen, you won't even need to use either of the barriers, except if you want to watch the bad AI pathfinding, as they get stuck attacking the barricades until you approach.After spending a bit of time playing this, I just cannot recommend Yet Another Zombie Defense. It's just way too bland for most people to put up with. The levels, characters, weapons... everything just feels so dull and lifeless, with miniscule replayability, even with co-op play. The developers of this game could have done so much more to make this game stand out, to make it worthy of the jokey name they gave it. But in the end, YAZD ends up being the only one to laugh at its own joke, one that most people wouldn't understand.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Pros:+ Music is passable+ Co-op play give this game a bit of longevity+ Simple gameplay...Cons:- ...perhaps a bit TOO simple- One level; no more, no less- Weapons lack oomph, not many of them are useful (especially barriers)- Animations are awkward, both in characters and weapons- Only two songs in the entire game- BORING

content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
Way too repetitive.+Direct and easy game+Players share ammunition+Multiplayer makes it a thousands time more interesting-Waaaay too simple...-Too few weapons-Too few playable characters-Only the host can manage things (buying, selling and placing items)-Doesn't deserve to be paid-There are hackers-There are similar flash games for freePROS1. Direct and easy gameThe game itself is very easy and simple. You know your goal, which is to survive the zombie horde. Having such few and simple tasks makes you keep more focused. Moreover, the controls are extremely easy and it is almost impossible to get lost in the controls.2. Players share ammunitionA fact that adds a lot of realism to the game, players always share their ammunition and money earned with each other, trying to survive the zombies. This is an excellent factor that consists that both players have to save ammunition as much as they can, in order to have better weapons sooner. Well, they're in a zombie horde together, they have to share the 'wealth', don't they?3. Multiplayer > SoloMultiplayer is a thousand times better than single player. More funny and more challenging. Single player sucks, seriously. The zombies always come in your direction and in a straight line. With multiplayer tasks can be divided (one defends while other fetch ammunition, etc)CONS4. It's too simple!You just defend yourself from zombies. Nothing more. Okay, okay, I understand, this game IS defending yourself from zombies --but, there's literally nothing more! Nothing more! The terrain is flat, there's no boss, there's only one type of ammunition, there are only two or three types of zombies (slow ones and fast ones) and you can only kill a zombie if you shoot it in the head! What the f'ck, seriously~5. Few weaponsThere are just a fw weapons, ten or eleven, I estimate (along with one turret). Some have different aspects from each other but there are not enough weapons! This game's lacking mines, solid walls, homing missiles, katanas, daggers, bows and maybe some buffs? Bruning aura, speed aura, defenses, healing, luring... What about pets that deal a little damage? Or guns upgrades?6. Three playable charactersJust three: one guy, a girl and a SWAT member. They're all the same, the only difference between them is the appearance, nothing more. One could be a bit stronger than other, or faster, maybe more accurate? Or there could be level up system to increase defense for a small amount? But no.7. Only the host does things between waves!Let me explain. Zombies attack in waves. Between those waves the host can buy weapons or barriers, manage the ammunition or disassemble turrets. What about the other players? They just keep looking! Sometimes you want to help, building a nice blockade or buy a different ammunition and you can't, because this game system is bad! Being host means being the king8.This game doesn't deserves to be paidNot even a penny. The game itself is cheap (I bought it for ~R$1.50 -- ~US$0.70, I think) but I recognize I wasted my time, that this game shouldn't even be worth a penny. I bought the two-pack to play it with my cousin but now I realize this game was a waste of money and time (sorry developers!). The whole game looks like it was made in a hurry, to earn money and nothing more. It's so badly made that I played for half an hour and earned about 50% of the game achievements...9. HackersThe game community is dead. Along the dead community hackers usually join you room and eep trolling zombies and killing the rest of the fun and constantly you have to stop waht you're doing and ban them. I don't blame this game for the hackers, but they're annoying.10. There are similar games for free!There are similar flash and unity games like Yet Another Zombie Defense for free! Some of them are Boxhead series[www.kongregate.com]. And even they're simple, they are as fun as YAZD and free of charge!

content:
Posted: September 21, 2014
												Okay so, you start out with a team of special tactics police officers and go to investigate these mountains where people have been getting killed. The forest looks normal but then out of no where you get attacked by zombie dogs and seperated from your team! So you get to a mansion and you're stuck inside - best thing to do is to search it and.... and... wait that's another zombie game. Damn. Hold on.Alright, got it this time - so you begin the game as a team of four survivors, you're all going to have to work together to make it through this thing. You start out climbing down off the top of a building in order to reach the evac center located at the near by Mercy Hospital - but before you get two feet down the street, Bill's getting pounced on by some Hunter and Francis won't shut up about hating... No, no, no! That's wrong too! Ugh, one second...Okay, this has to be it, sorry about that. You wake up in a field with nothing but the clothes on your back and your trusty axe at your side, within seconds you begin to feel a horrible sense of dread creep upon you as you have no idea where you are or whats lurking just over the hill. You make a mad dash in a random direction you feel might be safe in attempt to save yourself and spy out a cluster of zombies to your left - but what really worries you is the car passing by on the nearby road. As the car slows down to a stop thats when you know you're in trouble - and I've got the wrong game again...You start out with a group of your modernly trained warfare soldiers and fight off hoards? No, thats not even a full game... Ah! You're in space and theres this cult making zombie-alien-mutant things out of the crew, no this game wasn't in space. You play as a child trying to make the best of things and keep her group together as you try and survive a harsh and unforgiving appocalypse? Okay, I know it wasn't that game.What the hell did I just play then!?

												I think I paid something like 49 cents for this, and it gave me about an hour of fun local co-op play with a friend.  It's not worth full asking price, not by a long shot.There isn't much to the game and from a "game design" perspective it's pretty amateur.  However it worked with no bugs.I found the 'base building' to be tedious and unenjoyable to the point where I just erected a ton of wood walls as quickly as possible so I could quickly get to play the shooting part of the game.  I had no interest in exploring other options because it was a guessing game... there's no in-game information about why one base component would be better than another and I really didn't find myself caring enough to explore.The shooting part of the game is sub-par as well, but not super glitchy or annoying.  Aiming is a little wonky as your have to learn to aim above the zombies.But all in all if you like top-down shooters, buy it for an hour of something different.  I know that after my first hour or so of play, I won't ever come back for more.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												In the very short ammount of time I (thankfully) spent playing this game, I was surprised time and time again - and not by a thrilling storyline or astounding graphics - but by the sheer lack of depth this game offers. Needless to say, I didn't expect much going in, as the title and price surely indicated. But a part of me, maybe niavely, at least expected some basic core elements of a shoot em' up waze-based zombie survival game, such as noise made by either the zombies, my character, or guns. Nope. The best you get is a single monotous thud sound when firing some of the weapons - which sounds less like an actual gunshot, and more like the sound of your heart sinking at the sight of this game. Another basic feature that is missing altogether: a point. Sure, it's called Yet Another Zombie Defense for a reason, and that's exactly what one should expect from it. But the utter lack of depth to the game - besides a handful of guns to buy and a few player upgrades (which are unlocked here and there, but don't provide much difference to the game) leaves you bored after only 5 or 10 minutes.Ultimately, if you buy this *flash game*, here's what you can expect: running in circles in an extremely limited, un detailed environment, shooting identical zombie after ifdentical zombie silently, while a repetative music track from some royalty-free music site plays endlessly. Oh, and keep an eye on your health, because there's no sound or visual indication that you are being hurt, other than the small red bar in the top corner of your screen disappearing with each hit, making you question if you're really playing a game from the 21st century or not.However, I understand the limited capabilities of independent developers, and for that I feel this review may be a bit harsh. But, then again, independent or not, if you want good reviews and happy players, make a decent game.Thankfully, I only payed about $1 for this game, and I do know that you get what you pay for. But, then again, I've played free flash games that are 5+ years old that are easily 100 times better than this garbage. Don't waste your time or money here.

content:
Posted: June 6, 2014
												What do you get for $2? Yet another Zombie Defense game.  Not really a lot to this, but you're also not paying a lot either. It's a very simple hold your ground horde defense mode game. There's a fairly nice selection of weapons to pick from and 3 characters, but they don't really matter as they're visual only. The real "meat" to the game is the auto-turrets and walls. The auto-turrets allow you to place ANY gun you've bought on them and it then becomes that type of turret in effect making this a kind of tower defense game. You can even set up the little walls so zombies have to maze in through your towers to get to you. Will you play this much? Really depends on much much time you want to put into the walling and turret system. If that's not your thing, then this won't offer much for you. Do I recommend it? Again if you like those things it can be a good time killer while waiting on something else to download. So for that alone, yes I do recommend it.

												First of all...before you bash this game for being a money milking game for charging $0.72 for two copies you need to understand the game. Firstly you're promised to shoot zombies just from the title and the the developers go full into consumer needs and puts multiplayer as a free bonus just for buying there game. They have over 10 different buyable in game weapons and structures to help you slaughter many zombies with your new favorite multiplayer game.This game has amazing graphics that put the Gameboy Color to shame, gameplay that makes Candy Crush look like a bad Tetris ripoff and animations that put the N64 to shame.Choose between 3 advanced and intriguing characters!The Guy: A broad man with a hat and jeans ready to murder zombiesThe Girl: For all the horny teens out there that just want there senpai to notice themand lastlyThe SWAT: For all the adults playing this game with their children.This game has many weapons including:A pistol: Your everyday basic weaponSMG: Your bullet hose that happens to kill zombiesShotgun: Just listen to them sound effects and look in awe when the zombies fall before youFlamethrower: I mean seriously! IT SPEWS FIRE!Assault Rifle: A stronger version of the pistolSniper Rfile: A one shot glory of madnessRPG: THIS GAME HAS FREAKIN' RPG'S!!!!!!and much more...Fight the same enemy over and over! You know what screw the special infected in Left 4 Dead we only need one simple, not confusing enemy to slay.Overall this game is worth the 72 cents for this well made flash game.10/10 Game of the Year

content:
Posted: May 15, 2016
												A game like this is fun with friends...thats about it. Not much to this game. The only thing that I can say that sucks balls, is the tower effect. Whats the tower effect? When you go really far in a tower defense game, then you lose. All progress: Lost.  Its over. What now. It puts you in a slump is all, and some games are very forgiving with this minor annoyance. This game is not. Nothing much happens after you lose. No story, or anything. I know, I know, its an ironic joke game, but ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥it im going hard on this for a reason. You dont NEED a story in a good game, but it sure does help games like this. There is NOTHING to go off of. Only kill, build, buy, lose. Repeat. It gets old. REALLY fast! If you play this game all night, you will hate it the next day. With other games you do that with, you might take a break from it, or find new respect for it, but this is NOT that kind oof game. It puts you in a really bad mood after you lose. And that's about all that I need to say that it sucks. Sure, its creative, it is sort of fun and cooperative, but no good game should make you feel like♥♥♥♥♥♥after 20 minutes of playing. UNLESS it has a really sad story! Story? Oh you know, that thing that Yet Another Zombie Defense GAme doesnt have at all? Do you want to buy this game? Sure knock yourself out, but dont complain when you get a headache. In some ways, its worth it. One of those Play-with-your-friends-on-a-sleepover-for-about-30-minutes-then-refund kind of game.

If this was a free to play game I would recommend it, but if you want to buy a co-op game where you have to shoot zombies just save up some money and buy something like Killingfloor 2. The problem I have with the game is that it doesnt excell in any cathegory. It looks awful, the gameplay is immensly repetitive, the music is nothing more than noise. On the other hand, if you like tower defense games, zombies, have some friends to play with and the game is on discount, it might be a good deal.

content:
Posted: January 30, 2015
												Zombie Herding Simulator 2014I have only played this game 2 hours total, but I feel that 2 hours warrants a review. What is this game about?It is a simple game. The entire game is based around killing waves of zombies.In between the waves of zombies you can build fortifications and have turrets, as well buy new weapons. I have yet to do that.This game is extremely fun and is casual gamer friendly. It is fun and is a difficult game. Since I enjoy just collecting Steam Achievements I have been trying for my first 2 hours of play to survive past night six without buying anything. I have yet to get this achievement. You learn how the zombies move and how the herd moves. It really is an awesome game. Even though I do not hate DLC's as much as the devs do. I bought the game with a steam coupon I recieved after making a badge. With the coupon I only paid .20 for it. I honestly would buy this game at full price, it is well worth the $2.00 and is a nice little time killer when you want to just shoot pixels and survive a Zombie Herd. I actually do not like tower defense games, but I like this one. Excuse me while I go back to herding zombies.

												I haven't played this in awhile, and even with my playtime being what it is, I can tell that if you get into the right game with the right people, you can easily snag all of the achievements and all of your cards within an hour. Really, that's the whole point of "YAZD." It's uncomplicated, unpretentious, and it's cheap. You pick a character, you shoot things, you build defenses with what money you have, you upgrade your weapons, you get more ammo, you pick up health, you run in circles...not much to it. What you can expect to get out of this game is exactly what's in the title already.And for 2 bucks, why wouldn't you give it a shot? Does what it says, gives you a few little bonuses here and there. Totally basic, and there's tons of other games that are exactly like this one. This one has the bonuses, though. Most of the other ones do not. Taking it for what it is, 6.5/10.

content:
Posted: March 11
												This game exactly matches my definition of a small indie game: it's simple and fun. Totally worth the price and the time I've spent with my friends in this game.You're spawned in a small rectangle world and must survive waves of spawning zombies! You start with pistols & few zombies and work your way up to Rocket Launchers, Zombie Hordes, Barricades & Turrets. BOOM-BOOM! A basic hero progression system is built-in as well, so in the end there're many possible tactics you can come up and tinker with to reach ever higher levels! (achievements & highscores)I do recommend this game and advise you to only play with friends so you can talk and plan your defenses and purchases beforehand.

number of helpful: 8 of 20 people (40%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												Feels more like a free app that you download, try, then never play again due to indifference. Not sure what vested-interests many people may have to give it such a high amount of positive reviews, but it feels like it was made by someone messing around one afternoon with a game-making program that promises 'much success, monies and women'.I played 3 hours, which ended up being more for the achievements.. which I feel kinda sad about. Still, credit where it's due, it's almost free when on sale.(edit: Looking through my old reviews and it boggles my mind how something like this can have so many positives. Let's be frank with each other for a moment.. everyone's favourite 16-yo YouTube celebrity said it was amazeballs and everyone swooned, bought it, and couldn't disagree with their idol, right? Gotta be some reason behind it. Certainly any negative reviews seem to get trashed with the downvotes. Let's put it this way - most of the positive reviewers barely have an hour gameplay, and most above that only have enough to get all the trading cards while they went out for a few hours. Can't be that amazing after all. Sick to death of 'apps' like this clogging up Steam, and the review system is about as reliable and trustworthy as Trustpilot.)
